RddbLatcczppoh6J6JmGWw.text: Delicious pimento cheese ball served with fresh apples slices and crackers. We ordered the daily pickle which was cauliflower and delicious. Mac and cheese is creamy and delicious, you can get fried chicken skin on top. I really enjoyed the thermos of coffee in a thick old fashion cup. The whole vibe there is great for a date. I can't wait to go back!

_VVruzeS7L0CfYvWcnOA0Q.text: Excellent fried chicken, collard greens and mixed drinks. The chicken is worth the effort. Good pricing on food.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. No more Romance.
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice IC.
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

nj-y2q97wpTNW5wIDOIIIg.text: Seriously incredible chicken, period!! Wifey had been here before when visiting a friend and demanded we stop in on our way to Savannah. I had the 2 piece chicken, dark meat. She went with a few chicken tenders. We also added in am order of devilled eggs, hush puppies, charred okra, creamy kale grits and Mac and cheese. The chicken was brined and fried to perfection, serious business!! The Mac and cheese was good, the grits much better and that damn Okra, holy hell!!! I've only had okra fried, which I'm a huge fan of but this is easily the best I e ever had. It was smoky and seasoned to absolute perfection!! Definitely coming back if I'm in Charlotte again.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and cheese
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders, Alabama white sauce
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full southern food spread

UdNeef4smqa6By5eV9SAEg.text: The hype is real! Went a few weeks ago when my parents were visiting. We all loved it. d Downloaded No Wait app (@ the time it was a separate app) and was very easy to get our name on list when we knew we wanted to go. Arrived earlier than the time told us on app and they seated us right away (early). Ordered a few beers but want to try their fancy cocktails next time. Deviled eggs were good and so was the pimento cheese with fried crackers. Apples with pimento cheese app was a nice new touch. Dinner - shared a few big sides, too much food! Chicken tenders were amazing and huge, no joke. Plenty of leftovers. Not a fan (that night) of their cornbread pudding but definitely want to try diff sides next time. Husband added waffle with his chicken and loved it. Will be back and recommend you check it out too!

IZB9c5xfZb1ZfSeFy8WhhA.text: Came here on a Sunday evening. I was under the impression it was a very small estblishment. But they have a good amount of seating. Inside had a wait, so we sat in the outer portion with no wait(right where you can see the entrance to Mangos). Good amount inspects flying around that kept flying into my eyes. Very annoying.   Stephanie was our server. 3 of us shared a family style Mac & cheese with chicken skins. It was ok, had a kick to it. And each of us ended up getting chicken tenders and a waffle. Overall it was ok. It could be a option to return in the future, but I'd like to explore some of the other restaurants in NoDa.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2 tenders with some type of bbq sauce. The sauce was delicious!
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tender &amp;.waffle. waffle has sugar clusters in them
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and cheese with Chicken skins

sAzDJMpUmuxli-AAYSevqg.text: What a beautiful restaurant in the innovative and interesting NoDa neighborhood. We walked in and with no waiting, were welcomed and seated at a table in the middle of everything where we could see the dining rooms and the food coming out from the kitchen. We could see the long bar and nicely appointed back area. This place knows and celebrates its textile manufacturing history-  beautiful wood, mill spools for bar seats, so nice to enjoy the ambience.  On the menu- Plenty of snacks, light bites and main meals to choose from including Cauliflower steak, Trout, Ribs, hush puppies, crisp and juicy chicken tenders, and deviled eggs.  We were actually there for coffee and dessert but had to try some other good food treats.  All tasty, seasoned, hot and fresh.  Sonker--- oh yes!! Like a fruit crumble or pie, mine was fried apples with a sweet cream- like a caramel sauce on the side that made it perfect. The chocolate Sheet Cake with raspberry sauce made my eyes water - all so Good.  We don't know a lot about Southern food (from SF, CA) but we are fans now. We'll come back to enjoy to other choices on the menu and a custom cocktail !

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gotta have Fried Chicken- hot fresh - go ahead order a couple to try. Really good.

9OgA2VH-YwyHpmTryljoFg.text: BEST fried chicken I've had in Charlotte! And the mac and cheese with chicken is beyond amazing. Pickles, deviled eggs, what more could you ask for! Didn't get to try the cocktails this time around, but looking forward to going back.

uKIg4E3BLZdLCu8IzTNj_g.text: I was excited when my Yelp search turned up this highly-rated restaurant in NoDa.  How could we go wrong? We were able to visit before the lunch crowd on a Friday. A quick look at the daily specials and menu warranted that I try the Daily Fruit special consisting of Macerated Strawberries over Carolina Gold Rice with benne seeds. Fruit over rice? The waitress shared that it was a breakfast bowl so I had to have it. I was NOT disappointed. Oh, my! The warmth of this dish filled my soul with joy! I also ordered the Kale Salad (half size) which was tastefully prepared with halo-type oranges, benne (sesame seeds), goat cheese, and pomegranate molasses dressing. Delicious! Both dishes were tapas style but without the cocktail. After my meal, I was a happy camper the rest of the day.  The restaurant has an extensive cocktail menu that will let you get your weekend started off right!  Overall, a great meal with great service.  Oh, they have a nice outdoor patio area as well (see photo). Can't wait to return for more delectable dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cocktails
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar

S8RC-XgOifTju45m1XSXQA.text: Ordered the deviled egg, NC trout,  BBQ ribs, BBQ carrots, cabbage and banana pudding. The sides are just okay, not recommend, but the trout, tubs and deviled eggs are nice. The ribs are pretty moist . Banana pudding is a bit sweet but okay too. Service a bit slow but acceptable.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. NC trout
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled eggs

Q1rYgKX5EVSrOlc59XKybQ.text: If an old fashioned and a big plate of fried chicken isn't the best thing after a long day of travel, I'm not sure what is. Landed at 10 pm in Charlotte and fired up Yelp as soon as I could take my phone off airplane mode. Wasn't able to find a ton of late night food, but luckily Haberdish was still going strong with an open kitchen until midnight. We were seated immediately and promptly ordered the aforementioned old fashioned and a local IPA.   Their menu is what my Southern partner calls "Southern nouveau" and we ordered allllllll of the things. Specifically fried chicken, kale grits, deviled eggs, and okra. The chicken was so fresh and paired perfectly with their house made habenero sauce. My only complaint was that they came around and collected our hot sauce mid meal, as it was obviously someone's task before they headed out at the end of the night.  Lovely ambiance and service made it an easy five stars for me. The area Haberdish is located in seemed eclectic and lively--would love to explore another time when I'm less sleepy and full of chicken.

8iO3dUI5LP5lrLdB8amzcQ.text: The food is amazing and so is the service. Looking forward to my next visit! They have a beautiful patio area! The service is awesome also.

UIu636KOAEMwIc3TPnn_2Q.text: The only reason this is getting 2 stars is because of location and atmosphere. Let's start with the drinks. At first it looks like you have a normally priced spirit list, if you read the fine print in the upper corner, it is 3 dollars more e pensive for them to just pour the liquor in a glass, 4 dollars more for a mixed drink. This is quite the shady approach to price gouging, because no one would pay 15 dollars for a shot of buffalo trace but that's how they sneak it in there. What can I do to not get this charge? I guess ask them to pour it down my throat.  The food, for sure not as great as everyone has said in reviews. The hushpuppies were bland. And the sweet tea butter was not impressive. Didnt add to the hushpuppies at all. I got the chicken tenders and waffle and while I loved the waffle, the chicken came out dry. The breading doesnt stick to the chicken and the plate was slippery so it was almost hard to even get a piece on my fork. The ribs were underwhelming and bland, covering up poor smoke with lots of bbq sauce, the sauce def was sweet baby Ray's. The collards were delicious. Wasnt super impressed with the tater tots, bland and unsalted and didnt have anything set them across for being "handmade". The worst part of it all was the banana pudding. It was for sure made the night before if not long before. They put the whipped cream on and put it in the freezer . The lack of freshness and the minimal amount of wafers was sad. It really was some of the worst banana pudding in the south. They should be embarrassed for serving that here in the south. For sure not will NOT be back. I'll be down the street at better establishments.

493oXLXOm-KGaPB2kuStQg.text: Great food, great ambiance had the hush puppies they were so good , fried chicken was great, drinks were awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

PddjnrQRwxC2IGipNKeJrA.text: Worth the hype!!! All styles of chicken were tasty. We also had the mac and cheese, which was magic. Also tried the hush puppies, deviled eggs and the dumpling side. Yummmmm. We will be back to try more of the menu!

TMpJmQ2zuCSiAYC2YPtlgw.text: Visited on a thundery and rain-soaked Sunday evening, so the warm and lively atmosphere inside was a delightful contrast. Definitely a feel-good, family-friendly place. I ordered the Chicken and Waffles (best fried chicken I've ever had), and the Mac and Cheese with chicken skin (full of flavour and greasy deliciousness, chicken skin topping was a revelation). Buttermilk ice cream was rich but refreshing, the perfect end to the meal.

eCy03fsno0DebS78adoN0Q.text: What a cool find in NoDa.  We've been a few times but after tonight I'm like "That's some damn good chicken."  Every time consistently good food. Southern without the heavy. Not greasy at all, except maybe the sweet potato dumplings.  But all the other sides are great!  But seriously, when have you had fried chicken that wasn't greasy?! It's here. But honestly the smoked chicken was my favorite. Having lived in AL, the white sauce was what's up.  Their version at Haberdish was perfect. It was about what I remember, complementing the perfectly cooked chicken. A must go.

AwVgfpyytGt3_5boHziAeA.text: Oh HABERDISH! You make my heart melt with so much happiness! The flavor of your food and the atmosphere of your restaurant is beyond great! And may I include your awesome staff, incredible drinks and unique way to give your customers their checks #masonjars! Who doesn't like a great mason jar! DETAILS PEOPLE DETAILS! It's all about the details in 2018 and Harberdish gives you that and so much more. Do not hesitate coming and bringing your entire crew to this restaurant. Suggestion, do as my family and I did and order EVERYTHING! Two people ordered two items each in family size from the menu and it feed a family birthday party of 15 WELL! And we even had enough to take home, it's worth every calorie you can burn that off later lol just enjoy the MOMENT!

sOmmI8TwNjq8AzxCNuJMzw.text: Absolutely amazing! Worth the (very long) wait! It's sharing style so you get to try as much food as you want and there is plenty on each plate to go around. I highly recommend the hush puppies with sweet tea butter and you can't go wrong with any of the punches. Drinks, food, and ambiance on point!

Qmxp6h8CUHTMWmqJSYJTgg.text: Awesome service! Great food! Amazing vibe very hip place! Would totally recommend the livermush toast! Amazing fresh bartenders with really cool concepts!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

olZMT4_KXmNQb1JwVPH7hg.text: Service was great, food was fantastic! Get the kale grits! Extremely good! We got multiple items to share at the table which turned out fantastic since we were able to try multiple things. The cocktails are really good and creative as well!

hlbEtjV-bFSo8Pr9Hqc2pg.text: Haberdish has been on the bucket list for a LONG time but he stars have never alligned for a meal there. We finally made it in for a late Saturday lunch when we had some guests in town. First impression was I love the openness of it and the covered patio on the side. The walls are made of brick and beautiful wide tables. We started with the bacon jam biscuits and hushpuppies. Both are great "southern" Foods and they know how to do them right. The bacon jam is more of a marinade, with nice crunchy chunks of bacon over the fluffy biscuits. The hush puppies are served with a sweet tea butter, which looks like tuna fish but tastes amazing and soft.   Both appetizers were enjoyed by our group. The menu is very small, which is my only complaint. I'm not sure if the dinner menu is bigger, but it's basically fried chicken, fried cauliflower steaks and a bunch of side options. So, obviously this place doesn't attract those who don't love fried chicken.   The fried chicken is very good. You can order tenders (2.50 each) or half chicken. Sides include Mac n cheese, kale salad, biscuits, and a few other options. We tried the Kale salad and Mac n cheese. I also have the cauliflower steak a try, which is "chicken fried" with plenty of fried batter. It was okay, not my favorite but I was curious about it and wanted to give it a try.  They have an amazing and extensive cocktail list, with various creative and craft choices. I went with the seasonal doc porters vodka base with watermelon juice. Delicious! We all loved the cocktails we tried. I'd love to come back for dinner or brunch but love the whole atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Watermelon rind seasonal cocktail
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hushpuppies with sweet tea butter
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits with bacon jam

mh_a5pCyeuCL917Dl2slZQ.text: I was a bit wary of all the good ratings, as I've fallen for this a few times and was sorely disappointed. Not at Haberdish!!   We went on a Tuesday night with my in-laws and we were seated immediately. The room inside was absolutely packed, which just shows you how popular the place is really. It was an ordinary Tuesday night after all!  The wait staff was very attentive and immediately brought us waters and took drinks orders. We also ordered a starter (deviled eggs) once we had our drinks, and our mains once we had the starter.   Now to the food: GREAT! We shared the smoked deviled eggs first and they were on point. I love deviled eggs, so I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to them. ;-) My father-in-law had the 2 pieces of white chicken, which were HUGE! He took home half of it! We also ordered a bunch of sides between the four of us and we loved all of them (kale grits, sweet potato dumplings, mac n cheese, bbq-glazed carrots, and the charred okra). The okra was absolutely fantastic! Definitely try it!   Now, my one potential point of criticism is that I feel everything is a tiny tad too salty. You don't notice it at first, but after eating for a bit, we all were very thirsty and it actually takes away from the unique flavors a bit. A little less salt and everything would be even better!   Overall, five stars on all counts. Service, ambiance, drinks, food, location. Perfect!

0IeF-s9nsdIeoDh0W0WWSw.text: Three of us went to have a lunch on Sunday. As expected, there were people waiting outside(They don't take any reservations)   Even I saw a couple of tables available for new customers while waiting, customers were not seated right away. I am not sure if it is part of marketing to show some customers waiting on a line or something, anyway we were seated at the right exact table that was empty an hour ago.   Finally after seated, we ordered hush puppies, chicken and waffle, biscuit and potato salad(cold side dish). Hush puppies were so great with sweet tea butter that comes with. The chicken was very crispy and tender inside. The waffle was mediocre. I enjoyed potato salad. Pickled onion and bacon was balanced well in the salad. Generally the food was great but it took so long for the food to be served.   If you are patient enough to wait for 3 hours meal(1hour table waiting, 1hour food waiting, 1 hour eating), it will be worthy to try!

NCwe_xZYJfP8l9B_3pkQ-w.text: This place was absolutely amazing! I had been there for brunch once before but last night I went to get drinks and some food and was not disappointed. I ordered the pineapple spiced rum punch and it was so delicious. My friend did the bartender's choice and the drink they came up for her based on her preferences was so good. We also got the okra, hushpuppies, kale salad, macaroni and cheese and chicken tenders. The okra is a must try and the hushpuppies were perfect. I ended up getting a second drink and did the bartender's choice and it was great. I will definitely be back.   The only downfall which isn't even worth taking off a star is that I did order the deviled eggs and they never came out. I would have like to try them but I'll have to save it for next time!

LAqAf7AJbPC3MD6MWRSIQA.text: Wow.  Enough said.  Is there a better restaurant in Charlotte?  We will have to be proven differently moving forward if there is.    The atmosphere here is excellent and the entire staff is as friendly as they come.  The time they take to explain the menu is great and their recommendations were spot on.   Start with the hushpuppies.  They are excellent and the butter with them make them to die for.  The fried chicken is excellent and so are the chicken tenders.  The breading makes them so delicious.  When it comes to picking sides I legit think they all are excellent.  We tried four, however our favorites were the sweet potatoes dumplings and Mac and cheese.  The cost is not bad for all his great food.  Go there and enjoy yourself because a food coma is coming soon

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Glazed carrots
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and cheese
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet potatoes special side

pzR8dtVrauRKkecd_zbYMw.text: Some interesting dishes. Deviled eggs w smoked whiles are really special.  The bbq glazed carrots are amazing & full of unexpected complex flavor. I wish I liked the rest of the menu more.

FXCjrkqnt6haH-iMPmULdA.text: food is served tapas style, for the whole table. prices are good and the food is DELICIOUS! i'm omw back again lol. This is a nice atmosphere to be with friends or date night or to even watch the game on a weekday evening. I love it here!

nvBRrMHYoNKB54ZBm2yJmg.text: The chicken is great and their drinks are unique and fun. Definitely a good spot for brunch and a relaxed vibe.

jcbkqk0hnzFR8Zrs6SPw7A.text: Love this place!  Been wanting to try and it did not disappoint.  Went for brunch and ordered the arugula quiche with wilted kale salad.  Delicious twist on brunch classics.  I couldn't resist and added the biscuits with sweet tea butter...flaky and so fulfilling.  Great service.  Beautiful space and great vibe!  Will be back to try the rest of the menu.

jGhO0nfAJvi3dnM45YCQzw.text: Great atmosphere! Best fried chicken I have had since moving to the area 12 years ago. Wait staff helpful and courteous. Highly recommend.

NQP2mRdjphMr6_D5_6ZPkQ.text: I love this place- the food is always amazing and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable! I always get their chicken fingers and share sides with friends. My favorite site is probably the sweet potato dumplings- so good!

nOQihbdTNMoYmx44IJKDnA.text: Fun trendy spot for southern comfort food.  I had hush puppies, chicken tenders and tots. The food was great! Service was great! Tenders came with 3 dipping sauces. The BBQ was my fave. My only complaint would be that it was way over crowded and not worth the hour long wait.

HROhvoGQ28PZZ4j4AQyA7Q.text: Awesome food and very friendly ppl. They got the best fried chicken in town and nothing can beat their beet pickle, which they said is part of their changing menu.

K9vqAJMSQskWTohavnYV5A.text: Went here for the first time last night, and it was so good! The service was amazing from the second we stepped inside. It's such a cool space - rustic and homey. The patio looks awesome. They have a great cocktail and beer list. The prices are really reasonable, so you can try a lot of the different 'snacks' and sides. We got the hushpuppies and deviled eggs as appetizers. The hushpuppies were AMAZING - Sweet and salty and the I could've eaten the dipping butter with a spoon. My husband and I both got chicken tenders. They were really good, but I would probably get a piece of chicken next time. The homemade habanero pepper sauce is really good. We got mac n cheese, tots, and charred okra. All were delicious! Make sure you get the banana pudding to seal the deal!

kgbp4fXvGLlKTYYkIOvbKg.text: Such a warm inviting atmosphere with great food! Try the kale grits, you will not regret it.

1JqhMVJvp_MqDMzCgCEAZQ.text: They have hit the mark every time. Service is great, food is great and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. Can't wait to go back!

V11tT4LVsMWs5DiFtS9inA.text: Delicious fried chicken!!!! BEST TATER TOTS I HAVE EVER HAD!!!! Ranch was delicious. Mac and cheese was awesome. Service was great:) everything was amazing we will be back!!!!

LKQ1-K4W2Zh-tsiut2ak9Q.text: Oh my goodness. This place rocks! It's so good that I'm actually writing this review from my desk at work 4 days after I visited. Why? Because I was starving and my mind immediately revisited the awesome, trendy place with amazing food that is Haberdish. They have delicious chicken tenders (for $2.50 ea., and they're large!) And the mac & cheese is to die for. They also have an awesome cocktail menu, and if you go during the week, there is no wait and the service is super fast! If you haven't gone, go!

JCtGU_y6dJkuOopn3sb--A.text: The hushpuppies with sweet tea butter to start was a great way for us to start the night. The fried chicken was delicious - seasoned and crisped perfectly. But the winner of the night was the waffle and ice cream for dessert! Save room!

8gZy3md3macYg--B8-oCfg.text: Dined here on their first "official" opening night and everything from the service to the food was on point and could not have been better.  Wonderful atmosphere - you can tell they have a deep appreciation for the neighborhood's history and this is reflected in the restaurant itself.  The food was nothing short of amazing. The cheese straws, hush puppies, okra, sweet potato dumplings and fried chicken were all standouts but for us the show stopper was the savory bread pudding!  What an amazing addition to the neighborhood and to Charlotte's food scene.

76JCL7nm1tt70JdbwU1m-Q.text: No doubt, the best fried chicken I've ever had. You can really taste the pickle brine and it's delicious. Hush puppies are the lightest, most fluffy HPs I've tasted. Mac and cheese was good but the chicken stole the show. Tip: checkin online using their app, the wait can be brutal.

VVneYsSxGqRaYASLUDQISQ.text: Had an amazing meal tonight!  Loved all the vegetarian options.  Husband and I shared the cauliflower steak and a bunch of sides.  The cauliflower would have fed a small army, but we loved it.  Intense but delicious.  Sweet potato dumplings were amazing...then again, I love anything cooked in sage butter!  Kale salad was fresh and okra was perfectly cooked.  Can't wait to return!!

a53dYmj3baVnLicxNCZwig.text: The food and service is really good, I got the 2 piece White with tots and kale salad. Also the rum punch is really good! I've been 3 times since they have opened and haven't been disappointed

yAiRH1Xas_2UAAxmN9yjCg.text: The hush puppies with tea butter was crispy outside and fluffy inside and delicious. Unfortunately everything else was average you can get anywhere else.

u_xuJktQbDLHmqNY683lXA.text: Love the food here! Classic southern! The cocktails are also out of this world. There is usually a wait and it can get crowded space wise - but so far the staff seems able to accommodate and handle it well.

j6ofgzCh3mK9_l2usq8dKw.text: We walked in for table of 6. Stated it was a 45 minute wait. Okay. So we go to the bar. Within 25 minutes we have our table and our drinks. Great! The service was SO slow. I have to say that our food came out hot but took us forever to order. At least 30 minutes for ordering. The deviled eggs were okay. A little under seasoned. The livermash was dry. My husband ordered two IPAs his second was severed in this small 8 oz rinky dink glass possibly a 6 oz. who knows?!. The service was just unbelievably slow with mediocre food. We probably won't come back. Also a very small menu. So I hope you like what's on it!

Myt7HAlRe9TxnKRYSV09Ww.text: Really nice new spot in noda. The drinks are pricy but they are unique so that's why. They are also very tastey. I was surprised how small the menu is. Really not much of an variety to choose from but someone told me to try the friend chicken so I did. Probably the best fried chicken I've had. It had a different flavor than usual and it hit the spot.

C9Q4PWP9hocZQMfXre2zHw.text: Beautiful restaurant, friendly staff. Had the fried chicken which was very good , the Mac and cheese was awesome and a corn bread casserole which was very good also. Couldn't make up my mind on a drink because the list of speciality drinks was long and they all had ingredients I never heard,  so I settled on the holiday punch which was awesome . I'll be back for sure.

OEkVKaBlUwv8JIW9tLXdqg.text: I wanted to wait until we tried it again before reviewing, Since we first went for dinner on their fourth night open.  The first night we both had chicken.  Her the white meat, me the tenders.  So damn tasty.  We had the roasted okra, mac and cheese, smoked deviled eggs, and tater tots in accompaniment.  All were extremely satisfying.  Those smoked deviled eggs are insane and my lady loves the okra. We made our second pass tonight with her mother.  Luckily, we got there early as the place was pretty full by 730.  The ladies stuck with what we knew on sides and chicken.  I ventured over to the pork shank.  The portions were all of a healthy size and everything was delicious.  We added the daily special pickled beets as well.  Tasty. They have the same ambitious sort of cocktails from Colleen that they do at Crepe Cellar, with a solid beer and wine list. We also enjoyed the banana pudding and the ice cream of the day, a raspberry cheesecake. The decor is homey and inviting with the dishes coming out like they just came out of your grandmother's china cabinet.   This is a solid addition to the neighborhood with fantastic gourmet southern fair.  I cannot wait until spring when they open up the barn doors.

deBi5RHcY2ion1LovqU3HQ.text: Love this restaurant! My partner and I always get the a la carte chicken tenders and then 2-3 sides and its more than enough food. Delicious Mac and cheese, biscuits, and bread pudding. Drinks are pricey, but if you're craving comfort food, eat here. Use the No Wait app to avoid the really long wait times. Or at least have more control over how you wait.

TY73tPpGXnYZ6kYw_6NXLQ.text: This was a nice restaurant with good customer service looked at other comments and pics so I had to try it out and was not disappointed but didn't like the sweet potato dumplings everybody was raving about but the chicken was the best thing to me and the kale salad the hush puppies really all and all a good experience

taZjDWeI0SibvzYr_2mHuA.text: Went for brunch, food was great, plates were cleaned! Cocktails were on point per usual. Service could have been more attentive.

jbLyp5gp6ls-3MTYvKUfcA.text: Best food I've eaten in forever.  I went with a group of five and we got just about one of everything in the menu and shared.  There was not one thing I could complain about.  Quantities will not disappoint.

f9sKDAqlVq66B0L5mwrABA.text: Really tasty food and drinks. The fried chicken is amazing and the sides were all terrific. Will return for sure.

4G6NXPGj2JHgM7PXP9GzQg.text: Love this place! If you like that southern comfort food, this is the place. I love that it has a gourmet twist! Amazing fried chicken -- tender, crispy, and juicy. A gem in NoDa. Walk around the area while you're there, such a great up and coming place.

uFKDY7cE1EcgL_-02blc8A.text: Had heard great things about Haberdish, but was even better than expected! I have grown wary of overpriced hipster "share plates" style dining (I.e. less food for more money), which seem to be most new trendy places in Charlotte. However, the prices here were reasonable, and the food was good, southern food (not a disappointing fusion). I had the hushpuppies, Mac and cheese, green bean casserole (special of the day), and, of course, the fried chicken. All but the Mac and cheese totally blew me away! The chicken was super flavorful, and crispy not greasy. The space and homage to the mill town heritage which NoDa came from is interesting and cool as well. I will definitely be back, and will try cocktails next time which I hear are great as well.

abDVJnEa8fUMZEThwlHm2g.text: The service was great, but the food did not meet our expectations! The chicken and waffles were overcooked, but Our waitress was great about getting us fresh waffles.  We did enjoy the hush puppies!!

TjrtKBkH7IAGg3jmjlFk5g.text: I was hesitant to try Haberdish as I did not like the idea that the menu mostly consisted of Fried chicken-just not my thing.  We tried it today and everything from the silverware, to the food, to the tasteful bluegrass music playing at the perfect volume, to the overall ambience was impeccable. Our server, Jamie, was absolutely great!  She was attentive and helpful.  We ordered deviled eggs, (best I've ever had-a hint of horseradish) chicken and waffles, chicken tenders with all 3 sauces (ranch, BBQ, and honey mustard,-ranch was my favorite), tater tots (highly addictive) and the best sweet tea (just like my grandmas-made by Jamie) Thanks for a great experience Haberdish! We will definitely be back to try some other menu items.

cuLMkGJvQndmEtdMaQvO1A.text: I highly recommend Haberdish. Can't go wrong by going here. Their homemade ranch dipping sauce for the chicken tenders is not to miss. Great job on decorating the inside. Service is decent. Only wish they took reservations.

gSEL-1_I4oNUy7INHnZupg.text: everything wa incredible. You do not want to miss out. I would definitely reccomed their cocktails.

lkQ4VGNv9i3qWoL4z9npVg.text: Super friendly staff! Food was a little different from what I expected mainly the sides but the chicken is awesome. Expect to wait awhile on a Saturday night. But it's worth it. Can't wait to go back and try their drinks.

y-RmZ4lVVDIUwthrnijpVQ.text: If you don't love this place you are crazy . The decor is beautiful,  the food is mouth watering and the service is amazing!

nsm6-Qtfl51VTeRY1x7ovA.text: The food was pretty good, the menu is very limited. Drinks were okay, nothing too special. We had a group of 6 and were told it would be an hour and a half wait. We tried to call ahead, they said they don't do call ahead seating. The whole time we waited there were two open 8 top tables. About fifteen minutes before they sat us, they sat two couples, one at each end of one of the 8 tops. Just seems like poor management/planning. The fried chicken itself was good, but I doubt I'll be back

AeIB2Ig-xSr0stgvYYrYrg.text: The fried chicken is absolutely delicious and rivals that of the gas station on east/south Blvd! The staff is helpful and the drinks are amazing (a little on the pricey side but absolutely worth it). The appetizers are creative and tasty. When it comes to main dishes, however, we'd love a couple more options! Oh....and they have tater tots!!!

7YCQR3RRpjUDOUAMk7lwNw.text: Stumbled across the place walking thru NODA on Friday around 5pm. Very limited menu. The chicken tenders were good. We also ordered the mac & cheese, carrots and tots. Tots were good, the other two were served warm. The chicken was nice and hot and I am guessing the sides sat out waiting on the chicken. Service started ok, but fell off as the place got busy.  Three stars is all I could give the place. The inside of the place was nice. Funny thing, the receipt and credit card bill both had nothing about the place. No name, address, nothing.

KNHbjuvsGtcORFZtt5h2eA.text: Fantastic local joint that hit the nail on the head for fine southern cuisine. Especially if fried chicken is a favorite of yours. The brined, fried chicken is crispy and oh so delicious, throw on a bit of their hot sauce and bam. Every side dish we tried, and we almost tried them all, was stellar, meaning star like in and of itself. If you try one and you don't like it take your taste buds to the doctor for a check up. Lastly, eat dessert in waffle form! Keep Pounding and eat great in Charlotte by dropping by this NoDa spot.

M3X1KJ16YeifYm2OLYCTiw.text: New favorite place in Noda. Was a pleasant experience from start to finish. Food was so flavorful and reasonably priced. We got the pimento cheese, smoked & fried chicken. Kale salad was yummy! The waitress was excellent and frequently checked on us and refilled water. Luckily we checked in on No Wait... the wait was 2 hours when we arrived. Only thing was- it was a chilly night and they had the large door to the patio open which took away from the coziness. Will definitely be back (with a jacket)!

CDgVNWMLAnm3LF01c50oHg.text: Awesome chicken!! The fried chicken and chicken tenders are great...large portions and crispy breading. They have a large variety of southern sides...Mac n cheese, okra, and scratch made Tater Tots to name a few. Had hushpuppies as a appetizer...awesome as well. Staff was very attentive and knowledgeable...cocktails and beer selection great as well. Will definitely be going back, great addition to the NoDa neighborhood.

s96U_3UuZGdyx-tU_KlYMg.text: Outstanding decor, food and service. We came here for a birthday party and everyone loved this restaurant.  The menu is exactly as advertised - it was like southern style favorites with a high end flare.  We can't wait to go back!

Xw8xJWGWIY1PNMZb__lauQ.text: They create some of the best cocktails in Charlotte by far!!! Jen is the best mixologist in Charlotte.  I described my tastes and she made cocktails that were out of this world.

hr8-ZKXtiLgJSVJmLOWhPw.text: After a great lunch at Crepe Cellar we decided to try their new place Haberdish for a few cocktails!! So glad we did, had a lovely table on the patio and a great server Cat, who let us go at our own pace, which is always nice. We love to dine outdoors so this will be a new place to frequent for sure. Can't wait to return to try more of what is offered on the menu!!

wAJZQQ0TyaIJ7KfptUt5yA.text: Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte!! Tip: Haberdish tends to fill up very quickly so add yourself to the waitlist on the Yelp app. If not, you could easily be waiting an hour plus on a Saturday night. It's that good!   We started off with the hush puppies and biscuits with bacon jam. The fried cornmeal dough with sweet tea butter is a taste of sweet southern heaven. We probably should have stopped here as the portions were quite large.  But we ordered more! had two fried chicken tenders ($2 each) which are brined, battered and fried and are surprisingly quite large. I love that their chicken comes from a local farm in NC (Springer Mountain Farms) where it is vegetarian-fed, hormone and antibiotic free. I also had a side of charred okra....a perfect compliment to the delicious, juicy fried chicken.  My friend ordered the pork shank which was more than enough for one person. It was cooked to perfection and had a smoky BBQ taste.   We also ordered the mac & cheese. Needless to say our eyes were too large and we brought home leftovers.   The atmosphere is lively and vibrant and has a diverse crowd of patrons. While we sat at the bar, there's both inside and outside dining.   Highly recommend Haberdish.

x8x3G7NiDKvibLwwzJfxCA.text: They have THE BEST Mac & cheese! Especially if you top it with the spicy crispy chicken skins

VFBa06pojqpl7shAdJT3lg.text: We had a decent experience here. We didn't wait long for a table. The restaurant is beautiful. We ordered a few cocktails. They were good and pretty! We ordered a few appetizers- Deviled eggs and the biscuit with bacon jam. I liked both of them but could do away with the biscuit. It was good but just really heavy. We ordered a few side items and some of us got fried chicken and the others got chicken tenders. We didn't get a side item that we ordered. Not a biggie but would of been nice to try. By the time our server came, we already started eating our food so there was no point of asking and waiting for it. My husband also ordered a dipping sauce with his chicken tenders and he didn't get it. So we had to wait on our server and ask for it.   Overall, the experience was ok. I can't think of anything that was very memorable other than how pretty my drink was. The fried chicken was good, just not great or that special. My husband thought his chicken tenders were just ok because the breading was very thick and crumbly.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken (dark)
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dumplings

J0cPof1UoqKX3TjYvAByHQ.text: The food and cocktails here were delicious. It's a new take on Southern classics. We had the smoked chicken with white sauce and fried chicken and some assorted sides. The only thing lacking was the service. Since we went when they were relatively new I expected there to be some hiccups in the service, but we waited like 30 minutes for some of the dishes to come out. Hopefully they've gotten better since then.

pYgeuCCdUjsSJpu-v9iByw.text: LOVE this place! They have awesome cocktails and amazing food! Classic Southern dishes. The mac & cheese is to die for! My boyfriend and I love coming here. We go about once or twice a month. The prices are awesome too!

UDfBDEuo-zXnUbogLRnB4w.text: Haberdish Classic Old Fashioned   Of course it rained while I was sitting outside waiting 4 my food. So I opted to sit inside at the bar. The staff members were super friendly.   The cocktail menu makes it hard to choose a drink because they all seem tasty!!! I ordered the Haberdish Classic Old Fashioned. The frozen rose in the middle of the earthy Bourbon ~~~DELICIOUS!!!!!   I ate the 2pc Dark meat & Mac. The food was perfectly seasoned. No salt\pepper needed. The house hot sauce was amazing!!!   Last but not least ~ I read other reviews prior to visiting Haberdish & the deviled eggs seemed to be a hit. I can now vouch Haberdish Deviled Eggs!!!! The smoked paprika gave it a homestyle taste.   I'll definitely be a regular!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Chicken
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Look at the Rose in the center ~ Haberdish Classic Old Fashioned

U7QpCBOuaAn2SrdMG9PoTg.text: Amazing fried chicken.   Amazing mac & cheese. Charlotte's not really a foodie destination, but i'd recommend this place with my eyes closed to anyone!

Ip98ky72RwmAEQxdOpaYnQ.text: Food is ok but cold after 1 min on the table as it's REALLY COLD IN THERE!!!  Please, stop the A/C!!! Ordered fried chicken with side of mac n cheese, sweet potato dumplings and corn bread pudding. Well... all sides are barely warm but definitely don't pick the mac n cheese that tastes creamy-grainy-peppery, not cheesy. We traded it for the kale grits that was good and creamy. Sweet potato dumplings will be probably very good warm with that nice taste of sage. Corn bread pudding wasn't what I expected but had a good taste. The fried chicken was really tasty, the batter was really good and crispy (sometimes too crispy/hard but overall very good). Didn't feel like trying desserts as we were cold and a bit disappointed as we had high expectations! Decor is really nice  I'll definitely give it another try if weather is nice outside!

5E8gYjMfuAUkPsgg1JjbOA.text: Not just a meal, its an adventure. I had to consume fried chicken before heading north and on my third try got a spot (mainly parking and other tourist issuses). Worth every bit of effort, cocktails were fantastic and the chicken was a.MAZ.ing. You must go and have fried chicken. Very relaxed and friendly atmosphere. When i am back in town, i will back for more fried chicken!!

2sTu4QWmf_4Qcd5g-GeseA.text: Awesome first experience at Haberdish. First off, no wait saved our evening. I put us in on a busy Saturday night before ordering the lyft, and ended up with around an hour to do some bar hopping before dinner. Estimate was a bit short, but no problem for us.  Drink menu and selection were rather impressive. I ended up going with a BBL stout and my wife chose a mint julep which featured great flavor and impressive presentation.  Regarding the menu, it is simple and small, but everything on there was intriguing. Yes, the fried chicken is amazing. Biggest surprise for me of the night was the sweet potato dumplings. Awesome flavor and texture. I would also recommend the biscuits and bacon jam - which was closer to biscuits and gravy IMO. I also feel you get a good bang for your buck. We split the meal (The sides are big enough to share) and our food bill was only 30. Glad they aren't overcharging and we were stuffed. We are definitely looking forward to coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mint Julep - metal straw was a nice touch!

yyTNag21k-DEWTxcuk56rA.text: Cute space and atmosphere. Cocktails are tasty, and the Mac and cheese with chicken skins is to die for! We ordered the trout and the smoked chicken. Interestingly enough, the chicken in smoked and then fried! Leaves the skin crispy and still has that smoked flavor. The trout was a little salty, but undeniable delicious and fresh.

68bOPk0UNyD6NPiMd64ZEg.text: Very loud and crowded. You need to stay in line for a long time. Smoked chicken is tasty. I liked it a lot. Not many choices in the menu.

9-uLIrf0Fk34HIHxqrRlvA.text: The food here is delicious! I tried what was probably the best chicken biscuit in Charlotte. It was crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. I also had a kale salad that was unique and flavorful. I did not care for their diet cola, but I'd love to come back and try a cocktail. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZjEipUuPEyh7vao-ubwQDA.text: Beat hush puppies ever. Took some to go and warmed up for breakfast the next day....amazing!!!! I also really liked their fried chicken and tater tots. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Just make sure you sign up on waiting list right here on yelp on Saturday and Friday nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Warming up hush puppies

5C2vaW9yz9z_tmlcwwS9YA.text: Haven't even tried the food yet, but I give this place a 1 star. The service is horrible. Our waiter was not friendly, he placed only two ice cubes in the water, and he did not refill our glasses. We waited about 30 minutes for our appetizer, and an hour for our food. Definitely will not be revisiting.

tco6qZL6EEFQpCT4tQ8Cmg.text: Southern inspired comfort food combined with excellent craft cocktails, framed in a "order to share" style restaurant. If you are from the North and you need to experience a nice intro to Southern food, try Haberdish.  From a native South Carolinian, I was excited to try out Haberdish's fried chicken and their take on Southern sides. The sweet potato dumplings are an interesting addition to the menu and pretty tasty, although I was not blown away. The grilled okra with bacon marmalade on top was pretty good as well (that's about as sexy as okra can get folks). Yet another interesting side, kale grits, which were good. I think I enjoy regular grits better though.   Saving the best for last...the biscuits and fried chicken. I know good biscuits and I can truly say that Haberdish has some of the best in CLT. They have nailed the art of biscuit making. The same goes for the fried chicken. Their recipe and process are on point and have set the tone for fried chicken in Charlotte.   The downside to my experience was the service. Even at 9:30PM we had to wait 15 minutes to get drinks delivered and longer still to put our food order in. Hopefully the oversight in service isn't a common thing.  Haberdish hits the mark with craft cocktails, biscuits, and their chicken, but could use a little tweaking in the sides and service areas...4/5.

xRMiA02JL2h3K1r1lKX75A.text: Very delicious food! Came here for brunch on Friday wasn't at all busy. We got taken care of in a timely manner as well. We orders hush puppies as an appetizer and it was quite delicious they weren't at all grainy and they had this really good sweet tea butter to go with it. I ordered the egg biscuit with a side of grits and cheese. The biscuit was amazing and it was at all dry! The grits were decent I typically don't like stone grits and reason being is because of the texture. Otherwise it was an amazing meal and I'd definitely be back for brunch again!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

EkUq_MeLC81Okkkx-2Z4rA.text: Recently visited Haberdish during a girls weekend in Charlotte. We shared a carafe of a champagne punch that was beautiful (pretty flowers inside) and also delicious. We also shared fried chicken, trout, kale grits, kale salad, and tater tots and enjoyed all of it thoroughly. All of that was too much for 3 people, so we brought a good amount home too. Definitely good to note that the small size of the sides is still quite large. The service was fine but could have been a bit more attentive in terms of checking in and refilling waters. Otherwise, this was a really lovely dining experience. Would recommend!

rxJLkk_iZsqLzGZ949Tgbw.text: We got our seat (3 guests) over 15 minutes ago and have yet to have our server come over. I'm giving it two stars instead of one because we waited at the bar and got a drink before, had the deviled eggs and they were great. The king drink was also good. Service has been dissapointing so far   Update: they apologized for forgetting about us, brought a few drinks an an appetizer: I respect that, and they treated us better

RYDSJB09CmMeRaMi-qYVYA.text: It took me way too long to try this place. The wait always scared me off, but that was just stupid - it's more than worth a 90+ minute wait.  I came here with my boyfriend and my parents, who were in town to visit. We each picked a few different items and I could never tell you what was the most delicious. Everything was exceptional.  We actually ordered the fried chicken but ended up receiving the baked. The waitress noticed about halfway through our meal and offered to bring the fried, but we (especially me - I don't eat gluten) were so happy with the baked that we didn't care!  Also, side note - I've noticed a few lesser-star reviews that mention the food being heavy and greasy. As I already mentioned, I don't eat gluten or any fried food whatsoever, and I had no problem finding plenty to eat. The menu has a ton of variety.  So good. Truly a gem in this city.

19AhER4zFaGT41pT1-mCIA.text: Greeted and seated quickly on a late Sunday afternoon, and the prompt and cheerful service carried through our time there. Four of us started with the pimento cheese ball appetizer (awesome), split a whole fried chicken and three sides, and had some left to take home. The chicken had the right crispy/juicy ratio - cooked perfectly. Sides were tasty, though the mac and cheese was a bit al dente for my taste. Nice selection of local craft beers and full bar service. It's in a great location in Noda, easy walking distance from the light rail station.

aXrdFsh6mAMrYmaxVQ0fvg.text: Haberdish is one of my favorite places to go for a shareable bite! I love to take friends and family and order a few sides to share. The decor of the restaurant has a warm, homey feeling. We were greeted and sat immediately upon coming in. The service is always great and the food comes out quick! This is a great place to stop for lunch. Their cocktails are not only delicious but instagram worthy! On this visit my server was Deron and he was extremely attentive and knowledgeable of the menu! I ordered the Mac n Cheese and chicken tenders for my meal and some boiled peanuts for the appetizer. We were in and out within a half and hour which was great since I was on a time crunch. However, usually I stay longer and never feel rushed or pressured by the servers. I would definitely recommend to anyone that's looking for some quality fried chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders and Mac n cheese

Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner menu

MPR9Mdm89dKzKgWGhvkEnQ.text: Great atmosphere and great food. Lots of people were enjoying cocktails but we didn't. We got so much food to share between the two of us because we wanted to try everything! Our order of deviled eggs, hush puppies, charred okra, two piece dark meat fried chicken, Mac and cheese, cauliflower steak and a biscuit left is with a lot of leftovers to take home and a $50 check. Favorite things were the hush puppies with sweet tea butter, charred okra, and deviled eggs. Everything else was good but not what I'd come back for. The biscuit was my least favorite.   Eating my leftover hush puppies, I missed that sweet tea butter so much! Should have asked for some to take home!

a8WqUW5nNVFZ_fpPWOgDcg.text: My wife and I visited Charlotte last weekend and we sauntered our way to this gem of a spot. We sat in a nice covered but open spot near the street. The food was amazing!! And the service was even better! We ordered deviled eggs with the smoke trout...you HAVE to get it with the trout! Trust me in this!   For the main entree I ordered ribs with a biscuit. Believe you me that was literally (not the term kids use today to mean not actually literally) the best damn biscuit I've ever had.   My very significant other ordered fried chix and  a waffle. She thoroughly enjoyed both and couldn't get enough of the hot sauce butter. She could have gotten enough because the service was that good there...it's a figure of speech people. Her food actually took a few minutes longer so they actually comped her meal which we weren't expecting at all. All in all banging place and when we go back to Charlotte we'll hit up this place again  P.S. Put their Habenero hot sauce on everything!! I wanted to confiscate it for my own uses but that wouldn't have been kosher

DRk2AFaviE9sjA2bpoVdUw.text: We loved it! We are from out of state and truly enjoyed a real southern meal. The chicken was  juicy and fresh.

xdI8meKcXi76CVxtYQ7Y1w.text: Great restaurant centrally located in the heart of NoDa. The stylish space is cozy and inviting. The menu is fairly simple but each dish is designed to deliver the taste of the South directly to your tastebuds. If you have to have one starter, I'd recommend the pimento cheese ball. Although the cheese straws or pickled items are tops too. The combination of pickled onions and green apples pairs nicely with the spiced pecan rolled pimento cheese ball on the house-made crackers. It's tough not to make a meal from it alone.  The star of the show though is the fried chicken. The skin is crispy and seals in the deliciously moist chicken inside. Paired with a delicious assortment of sides from charred okra with bacon jam to sweet potato dumplings, it's a filling dish.  Stop in. You won't be disappointed you did.

drK_t9C2JcfnM5jnB32lKg.text: Food and drinks are delish! Great date night spot. Service was personable. Definitely will return.

aCHQL1paRC5sshmbwX96NQ.text: The service at Haberdish is excellent and I really like the decor. My partner enjoyed the brined chicken, kale grits, and the pickles. The bacon jam biscuits are good but the fried chicken was disappointing. The sweet potato dumplings were great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits with bacon jam and a mocktail

wRxuVH9tQGaKMDEFfVoXBA.text: I've been curious about this place for a while now but never had the opportunity to visit so today it finally happened. My husband and I got here around 11:30am and luckily the place was busy but there was no wait so we were sat right away. Within minutes the place got jam packed and a waiting line started. Our waitress was really nice and very helpful. We placed our food and it did not take long at all. Between the time we arrived and the time we got our check took only 34minutes (yes, I counted it). We were curious about their cinnamon rolls and our waitress said they were pretty good. When they arrive what we thought would be one big cinnamon roll actually were two decent sized rolls that came with some caramel sauce that was simply amazing!  My husband and I both ordered chicken tenders and waffles that came with a Spicy honey butter.  We enjoyed our food very much. The price was fair and the service was good. The vibe of the place it is nice and the decoration has that rustic/hippie vibe that Noda has to offer. We had a great experience and we will return for sure!

The food was very good and reasonably priced. I will definitely come back and try the dinner menu... I've heard great things about their hush puppies.

It seriously is in my top 3 cinnamon rolls ever. I orderedthe biscuits and gravy thanks to viewing other post. Overall, the staff, place and food were Remarkable. 4p14410HOiEB2g4Rhtvxcw.text: Wow.  My wife and I wanted something  interesting when we visited Charlotte from Dallas.  Our waitperson was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.  The food was outstanding,interesting, fun.  The decor makes the place inviting and warm.   I devoured the deviled eggs, loved the fried chicken, and enjoyed the sweet potato dumplings, purple cabbage and the glazed carrot.  Loved.  Yum.  Interesting flavors and delicious.    If your visiting Charlotte, this place is worth the trip, difficult parking, crowded street and getting lost twice.  Great adventure.

c0sbDi5pltRdRdcBMHjfuw.text: This restaurant is a gem known for it fried chicken and unique cocktails. They did. Not disappoint. KUPM-ofdy3mhxROEu8S1CA.text: Be forewarned, there is NO ON-SITE PARKING, so plan on circling around neighborhoods behind it looking for a spot that's not a tow-zone, or using the gravel paid-parking lot a few blocks away. (Our waitress told us some people park at Heist and just walk the 6-8 blocks!)  Once you find parking and get to the restaurant, it's a hip vibe. Very cool bar setup, with patio seating options, both covered and uncovered. The menu is not huge, but the offerings all sounded very unique and they source a lot of stuff locally.   I came here with some friends for a girls night out. Unfortunately, none of the items I got impressed me. We ordered the PB & J Bacon Plate first but then our waitress said they were out of the jelly it came with (on a Tuesday night) and asked us if that was still ok. No thanks, we don't want just a PB Bacon Plate...  So instead we opted for the Smoked Deviled eggs which we had also been looking at. I'll be honest, for $6, I expected more than 4-halves (2. eggs. total.). They're eggs...and I'm sorry to say very bland ones at that. They weren't that smokey and I'm pretty sure I could achieve the same flavor at home if I just cut a hard-boiled egg in half and sprinkled smoked paprika and a few snips of green onions over it. I had thought about just ordering an assortment of "Snacks" for my meal, but by this point I thought I'd be safer ordering an entree. They have their standard fare but they also have a rotating Daily menu. I was originally going to order the Cauliflower Steak which a lot of people had said was really good, but our waitress mentioned that the "Daily" option of the Wagyu beef corn-dog had been so popular that it had stayed on the menu for several weeks without getting replaced. So I'm sorry to say I ordered that. Sorry because it was so underwhelming. It was literally just a large (1-2" thick) all-beef corn-dog and a whole-grain Chinese-style mustard for dipping. It was too spicy/horseradishy for my taste, and honestly it completely overpowered the flavor of ANYTHING you dipped in it, so what's the point of that? It wasn't bad....but it wasn't great. It did come with a Cauliflower "Slaw" that I did enjoy. That might've actually been the best thing I ate there that night. The fries that came with it were extremely bland. I asked for ketchup and our waitress brought out the tinniest little condiment cup that wasn't even half-full and had barely a tablespoon of ketchup in it. I also ordered a side of their Cast Iron Purple Cabbage...which like the deviled eggs, sounded much better than it tasted. It just was "flat" flavor-wise. I don't know how else to say it. There was no pizzazz, no pop. And I was expecting the cabbage to still have a little 'crunch', but it did not; it was the consistency of caramelized onions.   I'm sorry to say the whole meal was a big disappointment for me and given the difficulty to find parking (unless you're lucky enough to live nearby) I don't think it's likely I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu Beef Corn Dog with Cauliflower &#34;Slaw&#34; (a Daily special)
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cast Iron Purple Cabbage (looks and sounds better than it tastes)

YVyHeGL5zfe6zE0WMQA8XQ.text: Great first time going to Haberdish! Haberdish doesn't take reservations so I was a bit nervous with a party of 6 on a Saturday night but we only waited 15 minutes. Ambience was awesome and loved the covered patio with the huge barn doors! We ordered a lot of different dishes with our favorites being the mac and cheese, the cold special of the day (arugula and bell pepper salad), and the charred okra. The fried chicken and chicken tenders were yummy! Also ordered the cauliflower steak to try and be healthy but it's deep fried so that was a loss  would definitely recommend!

Jy2VEj1F2CpshlHVVAmD3Q.text: This Gem of a restaurant is located in the former mill town of North Charlotte which is now known as "NoDa". Features: According to their menu; Notice at the bar the counter top. It is a soap stone bar top that came from a quarry in Virginia. The table tops were hand crafted in town (Charlotte, NC). The bar taps are used spindles from a former mill. Menu Items Ordered: Fried Chicken, Homemade Tater Tots, Mac and Cheese and Sweet Tea. All food was delicious. I was full when I left. Customer Service: They really took care of me while I was here. I sat at the bar because they were really busy since it was lunch time. Several bartenders and waitresses spoke to me while I was here. They gave me water to start off with. Then I asked for sweet tea. My order was brought to me within a few minutes after ordering. Other Mentionable Menu Items: Deviled Eggs, Homemade Dill Pickles, Hushpuppies with sweet tea butter, and Potato Salad with fresh herbs. These menu items I did not try but are popular reading the other Yelp Reviews. How Discovered: I found this restaurant while visiting a coffee shop about a block or two away using the Yelp App. The food pictures looked good so I book marked it. College Students: Looks like while visiting this area, it is frequented by college age students. I see there are about 5 colleges or Universities within a 5 mile square radius of this restaurant which is why I see mostly people in their 20's out and about outside and inside this restaurant. There looks to be some apartments and condominiums close by too where they might be staying. History of Local Area: This is an old part of Charlotte that has been revitalized. I saw some industrial businesses in the area while on my way here. NoDa is a popular arts and entertainment district of Charlotte, NC. I saw a music venue across from the coffee shop I visited. You can find bands that play there too. I recommend visiting the online website of NoDa.org for more information to plan your trip in the area. Final Thoughts: Yes, I highly recommend visiting Haberdish when you come down here. They also have a bar where they serve drinks such as beer and liquor and even cocktails too. So, you can have lots of fun here which includes dining out, having a cup of coffee, drink a beer and finally see a local band play all within a block or two of this restaurant.

hYQcNJbTQ8I4hpDTHtL5sQ.text: I loved the food! The fusion of flavors and amount of food was definitely meant for sharing! This is a great place to hang out with friends after work or on the weekend. The drinks  were delicious but full of ice. I will definitely return multiple times to try everything on the menu.

S4iaL8yIRbzCk_1F-xmuhA.text: I relocated to Charlotte recently and my husband and I stumbled upon Haberdish one Sunday Afternoon. We were SHOCKED with what Haberdish had to offer. The chicken tenders were so tasty and perfectly cooked! The Mac and cheese was phenomenal. And the cocktails were a perfect concoction. The service was great as well. Haberdish is a MUST if you're in Charlotte!

8fqJKzmezp51ooD68YSU8g.text: Love this place. I have previously gone here for brunch during the week but this time it was for a late lunch on the weekend. To start, my friend and I both got drinks. I ordered the As You Like It and my friend got some sort of hibiscus punch. To be honest, I don't really remember what was in each drink. However, both were tasty and presentation was on point. You have to try the hush puppies. I'm not sure what it is about them but they are absolutely amazing. I would go here just for them. The sweet tea butter that comes with them is the perfect touch. My friend and I also order some fried chicken tenders (2 each) and mac & cheese. The chicken tenders were so crispy and fresh. I paired mine with some wing sauce and ranch. We asked for honey mustard too but the waiter forgot to bring it over, which wasn't a big deal. The mac & cheese was good but I feel like the macaroni could have been cooked a little more. Overall, everything was great and I will definitely continue to visit Haberdish when I am in town!
