VLwLtsfPOuvq0fd2SRVGJg.text: Nice ambience. Hipster style service. Foods are too salty which make it tasty. Nothing very impressive.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Everything is very very salty

7aJSiiB-zAJM23LAsawmBg.text: interesting place. mint jeulep was very good. other drinks seem unnecessarily high priced though. That does not lend itself to "stop in for a drink."  Had appetizers so can't say anything about the food. Service was fair.....more distant and distracted for an easy Sunday afternoon.  The restaurant is very desirable in design, decor, and space. I'm on the fence about a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. grown up&#39;s  Icee!

TDnl8mh3cUDGYybkYrwvWg.text: So very good. Make sure to get on the wait list before showing up. Brunch is a must try and possibly even better than Dinner

r-d5eaY2Su5y3W-u-bWoTw.text: Service was great. The fried chicken and the mac and cheese with chicken crisps on top were my favorites! Would definitely recommend!

klBcK9qKPwOEGWbQDsTomw.text: Was excited to try but was really disappointed in what we ordered.   Eggs Benedict served with boiled eggs? Waiter did return and bring back with poached eggs.   Wouldn't make another trip there

8o8NHrRA-iYcX-_p1tBaTg.text: Great tasting food, great drinks. Haberdish gave me lots to talk about this Sunday afternoon. I found Haberdish while looking for a good place to eat on Yelp. I was not disappointed.   Food: Walking in, I automatically knew the food would be good because it smelled AWESOME. I had the cauliflower steak and a side of tater tots. I also tried the Mac & Cheese. The cauliflower steak was good, the breading was awesome and the sauce on top as well. I think my favorite thing I tried: the tots. They're made in house from scratch. Major cool points for accommodating food options for all types of eaters whether you're a pescatarian, vegetarian, etc. The wait for the food was less than 20 mins. It was also a big portion. The food was absolutely the highlight of this place. Try the tots lol, you won't regret it.   Drinks: I tried a mimosa and an apothecary drink, the latter being infused with CBD. (So likely to bring a very relaxed feeling). Both very well made. More cool points: they squeeze fresh orange juice for all their drinks that have orange juice, right in front of you at the bar.   Service: The staff was friendly and knowledgeable and checked on us. No complaints there.   Restaurant hacks/Key Info:   1. If you're planning on dining here,  check for a wait on Yelp. You can even add yourself to the wait list. You can also order to go. This place can get pretty full so always check in and see if there is a wait.   2. Parking is pretty annoying/bad in this neighborhood. Prepare for that. Might need to drive around a bit.   3. If you are looking for BRUNCH, they only serve brunch on weekdays. Weekends they'll be serving the dinner menu in the afternoons.   Overall, I'd absolutely return. This place is great for outings with friends, significant others and even casual dates. The drinks are all really good as well as the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Syrups at the bar
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken

rvmwoSzVRIiY1rXEBMGr4g.text: I love this place!!! It's small plates so bring lots of friends.   Lots of places in charlotte have fried chicken but their fried chicken was still fantastic when we reheated the leftovers the next day!! The Mac and cheese is super yummy! And they have such a great variety of cocktails! I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

7v2RkBUjE8cVTj5d2Bswbw.text: Exceeded our expectations! Perfect birthday spot! AMAZING service! Great wine selection, sweet potatoes dumplings, friend chicken, collard greens, hush puppies and boiled peanuts! To die for! We are new to the south and this was a great overall experience!   Also loved the modern and farmhouse interior style! 5 stars for sure!  Thanks to our server Collin for the great service!

-Iiwx9PweT5lijqatIwMiQ.text: Finally made it here!!! I wasn't pleased with how they gave away my table that I called to  be put on the waitlist. See when I first called to inquire about reservations I was told to go on Yelp and join the waitlist. Problem was they only let you do 6 people and I had a party of 11 so it said to call the host. I called at 12:30 and placed my name for 2pm(Sunday). At 12:50 I receive a text stating that my table was ready and would be forfeited in ten minutes. What??? I know I told the Woman 2pm. Fast forward, we couldn't get down the street because the streets were blocked off due to a street festival. So I called them to ask them how to get around the closures and to let them know I was in the area. Welp I was told that my table had been given up because I didn't come within the ten minutes of the text message. I explained to the lady that I spoke with another woman earlier and I was to be there at 2. Well of course the lady said that she didn't know who I spoke with because they don't "reserve" tables. Ok so why did I have to call the "host" to tell her about my over 6 people?  Anywho, put name on waitlist again and waited about 45 minutes for a table. Ok now it gets better!!  The food was good especially the fried chicken. The Mac and cheese was different but tasty, as well as the coleslaw. I didn't like the deviled eggs, they were very bland. Their banana pudding is delicious to me. But our Server Margo was amazing and handled our party of 11 with such ease and grace. She recommended the pineapple infused spiced rum punch!!!! And I thank her to this very moment. It was refreshing and had a hint of jalapeno when you swallowed. AMAZING!!!! We ended up getting the large which came in a decorative bowl and a personal server(for the first round). The large was pricey but it was well worth it because three of us had 4 glasses each, and I believe the glasses were about 4-5 ounces. To me, the menu is very limited but straight to the point. But I'll definitely be back to sit at the bar for that amazing drink!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 fried chicken
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soooooooo good. Pineapple jalapeño infused spiced rum punch

DeWqAJtr8Xr_rpQPTNVdmw.text: The ambiance in this place is to die for. Such a cute restaurant! Pro tip: go with a party of 4 or more and make a reservation in advance! They serve their dishes family style so if you'd like to try their menu go with a large group!   Drink menu is gorgeous and the drinks itself are mouth watering. I got the coffee.....SO GOOD.   Man and I ordered our chicken (me dark with a waffle, him white) and shared a side of Mac and cheese. Chicken was delicious- the breading was thicker. Mac and cheese was also yummy but I would opt for another one of their sides next time. The waffle was the most surprising part of my meal- while it looked small it was dense and very filling. It almost reminded me of a soft pretzel- so good! Their syrup is super delicious and not too sweet. Perfect bite consisted of chicken, waffle and syrup...YUM!   We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

rme7s0g9e6k3WbNfVnTbKQ.text: An easy 5 star review. I'm a southerner, born and raised and I've been told about many great 'southern' style restaurants that have just failed to live up the the hype.  This place delivers on every count. You can't go wrong with the fried chicken which is everything that its billed to be. You get many choices of sides and I would suggest the okra, cornbread and hush puppies.  This place is very popular and they don't take reservations. They do have a cool feature that allows you to track your time progress to being seated once you give them your cell number and allow use to the Yelp app. Our group of 6 found it to be very accurate.  They serve next level cocktails which are very popular. Not all because they include some creative and exotic names and mixes but because they are crafted and poured by True professionals. The bar staff are all licenses and trained and have continuing and on-going training.   If you pay any credence to Southern Living Magazine, it's rated the No 5 top restaurant in the South, ahead of Commanders Palace in New Orleans and the bar came in rated as number 2.

yOQHiFzWBfyS29SpWZdkag.text: I went for a classic Sunday brunch with 3 other friends and had a great time at Haberdish! We got there a little after 11 AM on Sunday and the place was busy. We easily got seats and had to wait a little for our server- which was understandable considering how busy the place was. She was really nice and got our drink orders. I love the cocktail list here and the brunch specials as well. I got the Bellini and it was perfect with the right amount of alcohol in it. Next we ordered hush puppies, Mac n cheese with the chicken crumbles, collard greens, tater tots, fried chicken and ribs. The hush puppies were the BEST hush puppies I've ever had and the butter it came with paired well with the deep fried balls. The Mac n cheese was very al dente but I like it that way. I wouldn't get the chicken skin crumble on top though- just felt like a lot of extra oil. The collards were good and so were the tater tots, chicken and ribs. The only thing I didn't like was how oily and greasy everything was. I get that southern food is supposed to be deep fried but it doesn't hurt to drain off some of it afterwards. Next time I come, I'll definitely try more of the cocktails and just do a small side dish or two.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac n cheese, fried chicken, ribs, collards, tater tots
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cocktails

cDJ7ZQCtWvUXDC89lPpmGw.text: This place is soooooo yummy and I love they way you can share dishes! Also, the service is phenomenal. No joke.  Smoked Deviled Eggs-pure mouthgasm situation with these adorable kettle nuggets. The egg whites have such a beautiful smoke flavor as well as the filling, which is perfectly seasoned. Order these, trust me.  Dill House Pickles-dill because, what other type of pickle is there? Yummy.  Fried Chicken-came out hot and delicious. Seasoned perfectly. Also they make all of their sauces in house and are super flavorful, try their habanero sauce for some heat and vinegary addition that compliments fried chicken so well.  Charred Okra-cooked to perfection with balanced seasoning which highlights the natural flavors of the okra.  BBQ Glazed Carrots-they offer a nice touch of seeetness and were also cooked to perfection. Very yummy.  All in all, this place was an all around win.

Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Deviled Eggs
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dill pickles

ndtRLklzLiljNAtnezLkhw.text: I landed late in Charlotte so I stepped in Haberdish late (almost 9pm).  I was starved since my lunch restaurant (at the airport) screwed up my meal and only brought  out a starting salad.  Haberdish was amazing.  The cocktail selection was fun and crafty.  I got a couple brined chicken tenders as an appetizer . . Best fried chicken I've had in years.  I bet their chicken and waffles is to die for. . .  Dinner I got the lamb . .and it was a solid choice.  I even splurged for dessert ( a nice banana pudding) that just sealed the deal.  At the end of the day I was pretty happy I didn't eat much of a lunch since that meant I could really devote a solid appetite to Haberdish  Whenever I'm in Charlotte - this one is on the list.

kjcIySp4f61TWSPtFGU5lQ.text: The food was absolutely delicious.   Top notch ingredients.   Had the ribs and mac and cheese with fried chicken skin.  The ribs were about the best I have ever had.  Adding chicken skin to already decadent mac and cheese is genius.  Very well thought out restaurant from the interior to the menu.  Everything is a la cart, no complete dinners which makes it expensive.   Definitely not a place I can afford on a weekly basis.  I  go out to lunch 5 days a week and have a 10 dollar budget.  I could not go here for lunch.  Parking is a pain and I  just paid 5 dollars and parked.  This will be my go to special occasion/someone else buying restaurant.   Not sure of the sustainability of such a high price point restaurant  in an area full of young people.

YUa4mnAbdp-1dLg9-5NWoA.text: Haberdish and haberdash and haberdish and uh-  Look, this place may be hipster as all hell with a bike messenger aesthetic and a Park Slope menu but hot damn if they don't nail it. NAIL IT!  Smoked trout deviled eggs nestled in a bed of their buddies' whipped innards had that paprika kick and the lakeside bold and oily taste of a line-caught fish straight outta A River Runs Through It. Bang up starter, as were the light and spongey (?) hush puppies.  Because I'm an idiot and maybe I wanted to slip in to a food coma, I went full bird on the fried chicken thigh biscuit sandwich. The dark meat? Huge, boneless, endless brined and packed with flavor under an excellent fry. The biscuit? The baked good equivalent of the Burj Khalifa. Calling this mound of food affixed to the plate with honey a "sandwich" is like referring to the Colossus of Rhodes as a "nice statue." But it's not only the size that mattered - it had a divine crumbly without being dry. Nitpicking a bit, but the slaw was too oniony for me. Would have loved something a little more dill or poppy forward.  Oh, and the bonus dish! Decadent af mac and cheese pummeled - PUMMELED! - with spicy crispy chicken skin. After a moment of textural complement, the entire bite melts in your mouth.  It was at this time I realized I basically ate every aspect of a chicken, and I'm okay with that. Coffee is Counter Culture (I believe?) served in a Stanley Thermos (I know for certain). Clever.  Housemade hot sauce featured carrots and habanero. That factoid is for Nikki and Isaiah. Get a blonde bloody mary for a smoother, sweeter tomato and a guaranteed triple-digit like count on your Insta.  I wanna go back right now, but I just finished my last brunch five days and I'm still full, so whatever. You can have my seat.

kIJv5hUmcBs8V4CpVvkbkQ.text: Fancy southern food that gets the job done, without going overboard in it's modern trendiness. I was told this was a great place to get chicken and waffles. I decided to visit before I left for the airport, considering I would probably go into a food coma afterwards. I like the fact that you can order pretty much any type of chicken with your waffle. I was tempted to get chicken tenders, but I figured I should try the actual boned fried chicken. I went with dark meat, because not only does it have more flavor, but it isn't as big as a breast. I liked the spices on the breading. I can taste the sage in their mix, and it was quite pleasant. They had a great crispy batter, as it broke apart in chunks, dissolving into oily goodness. The meat itself was tender and moist. Not a single bite was dry or stringy. I also liked the grease factor was under control; the grease still had character, but never felt overwhelming on my hands or my mouth. Although I love my waffles crispy, I was actually OK with it being softer. They make their waffles dense, almost like a super thick pancake. In the center, there was a firm doughiness that I actually enjoyed. In a way, it felt like a hybrid of a pancake and biscuit, with it leaning more towards a pancake consistency. They offer maple syrup and honey butter on the side. I recommend you get both, but especially the honey butter. It was absolutely divine. I insured I dipped or poured my food with that honey butter every time. It was simple yet effective. I got tater tats for my side. I liked that I could get a half order size. Even though they actually made them extra crispy upon my request, I felt it wasn't to my usual standard of amazing tater tot texture that I forever crave. Taste wise an inner texture wise, it reminded me of a high-quality hash brown. I thought it went well with my chicken and waffles. All I was really missing was a Friday egg to make it a country breakfast hash. I would've tried the barbecue glazed carrots, but I already knew I wouldn't be able to finish it if I ordered it.   I like that this place stays focused on serving homestyle southern food, but still having a few twists and elegance thrown in the mix. Granted, this is my first time in Charlotte, but I thought this place was a great recommendation for having chicken and waffles (especially during dinner time). If you have a chance to come here, try to bring your family, as this is what the menu portions are geared towards. You can still eat solo, but make sure you bring your appetite.

2ezYThVXW5yfmRB9Y-Fxmw.text: No variety, the only taste food has is Smoke, and not in the good way. Servers usually forget about your requests...  place as well as people going there are Soo pretentious   I hate it.

ERiMlskSLgMmP962ilBdxA.text: I seriously can't think of enough good things to say about this place, as soon as we walked in I loved the way that the restaurant was set up. The interior and aesthetic was really open and gave you a really relaxed but upscale vibe.   We started off with a full Thermos of coffee and a round of Blonde Bloody Marys which are a lot easier to drink than your average Bloody in my opinion. They went down so smooth and come out a beautiful orange color I've not seen before. Next we tried the deviled eggs, hush puppies and biscuits. Everything was sooooo good and my mouth is watering thinking about it right now so I'm going to move on.   I went with an order of the Egg, Cheese and Bacon Biscuit and we all split a side of the Macaroni and Cheese with chicken skin topping. Just think about what I just typed right there. I don't even need to tell you how good that is.   Check Haberdish out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

eMGDvEl5NbE_maLU-Elg-Q.text: So, I would not recommend coming here for Sunday  brunch. Apparently they only have "brunch items" during the week, but not during the weekend. Having come here on a Sunday for brunch I was little disappointed to find out that they don't have any typical brunch items here. Their entree selection was a little skimpy. The only thing that seemed the most "brunchy" was the chicken and waffles, which I have to say was really good. The syrup that came with it was a honey butter and it was delicious! The kale grits was also really good and creamy. However, I would not recommend the sweet potato dumplings. It sounds good, but it does not taste sweet like a sweet potato and it was very greasy. It had no flavor. I debated on whether or not to give this place 3 or 4 stars. I was disappointed that they did not have brunch and there we a couple of items on the menu that they ran out of but I decided to go ahead and give this place 4 stars because the most of the food was pretty good and I did like the southern style ambiance. Next time I will come here for dinner not brunch!

q7WSOgs8t-yf_HkQKSqCyg.text: Very mediocre food and less than mediocre service. The Biscuits and Bacon Jam were fine. The Fried Chicken was the best part of the meal. The Chicken Tenders were mediocre as well. The Mac and Cheese was very garlicky but otherwise bland and the Sweet Potato Dumplings were not liked by ether of us. We were very disappointed based on other reviews that we have read.

XhW5YYUquxWiJg-YHJDlQA.text: Wow! Let me start by saying I am still full and I had brunch from 12:30-2:00 today at Haberdish. I m writing this review after 7:00 pm!   My husband and I had brunch at Haberdish for his birthday today, and I am beyond impressed. I wish we had come sooner! We started with cocktails and hush puppies. Our waiter recommended beverages for us based on types of liquor we like and his recommendations were delicious! The presentation was excellent with a mini carnation frozen in the ice cube. Love! The hush puppies are out of this world good. I could've had another order, to myself, and been so satisfied, but I wanted to fit into my pants tomorrow.   We were deciding between the half chicken or each ordering individually because I wanted to try the chicken tenders. The waiter suggested we do both and it was way too much food, but delicious nonetheless. We also ordered the house dill pickles and the macaroni and cheese. The pickles are AMAZING and the mac'n'cheese was good but I've had better.   For my husbands birthday, the served him a banana pudding with vanilla wafers great in a mason jar. It was adorable and so delicious. I am so impressed and I can't wait to bring out of town friends. I want more hush puppies now so we will be back soon!

X9K10K-im-oulnxJM1mzwA.text: This is a terrific cocktail/dinner venue.  It can be AMAZING food - but be warned, sometimes it can be a bit of a miss.  In December we brought friends for fried chicken, sweet potato dumplings, bacon okra, smoked chicken and a variety of house cocktails.  It was truly honestly fantastic!    We took a second bunch of friends visiting from LA in March and it was good but collards were a bit bitter, chicken a little underdone, ribs were ok and service was slow (cocktails still terrific)     Try to get there around 5pm otherwise it gets crowded.  You can park at the Y across the street after hours.    Give it a go.. not a bad choice.

q7G4uPnRMXV312n2483Cxg.text: I really love everything that Haberdish has to offer: the atmosphere, the decor, the drinks, and the food!  It is a very chic, modern restaurant. There is a big dining room, a nice deck when it's warm (it's covered and functional in colder weather, too), and a decent-sized bar. You can go for weekend brunch or lunch/dinner any day of the week.  Their cocktail menu is never anything less than stellar. They have at least a dozen signature cocktails that are always evolving. They can whip up anything your heart desires, too.  Other than the mains, the menu is mostly small plates (but still decent portion sizes!). Most people will choose from fried chicken or ribs. As a vegetarian, I enjoy their fried cauliflower with chimichurri sauce. I can eat almost any side. Their house-made pickles and deviled eggs ROCK. The mac n cheese is too creamy for my style but the sweet potato dumplings are delicious. Next time, I'm trying dessert.  They use the Yelp waitlist, and you should be prepared for a long wait. Grab a drink and get ready - it's worth it!

s10WT-PYIxeXhk2z5zOYsg.text: Food was great, service not so much. Never got drinks refilled, hard to waive down someone to take our order, 20-25 minutes just to get our check and pay. A little disappointed

wm1IWo-4HwK-gP-exoLfNA.text: Love it!!!!! If I could afford it. I'd go everyday!! The drinks are amazing and the Deviled eggs are from heaven!!

d2Cy92oWrJElA07Wpw7bjg.text: This is a long over due review.   We went to Haberdish with a large group of 10 people (this is to be avoided in the future as the restaurant isn't really able to accommodate this large of a party -- reserve for date night or dinner with one other couple). Although we called ahead, used no wait app -- we still waited 40 minutes.   The wait really wasn't a huge deal to me. We posted up by the bar, perused the cocktail list and got busy sipping! I ordered 'The Local Melon' - Doc Porter's vodka watermelon and lime juice, sweet basil bitters, cracked black pepper and a salted rim. It was divine! I made the mistake of adding it without the flowered ice cube. The second one I ordered I got the flowered ice cube. Note: do not forget to ask for the ice cube. While their drinks can stand on their own as far as looks and taste go... they become instantly Instagram enviable when you get the gorgeous ice cube!!   Once we were seated, we ordered biscuits and bacon jam for the table. The biscuits were good - not great. I love a really fresh and fluffy biscuit. These were a little denser and drier. The bacon jam though -- I'm currently licking my lips thinking about it -- yes, it was that good! I ordered the roasted chicken and sweet potato dumplings. My goodness! Those little dumplings were delicious! Tender and sweet. I highly recommend them. The roast chicken was actually very tender and juicy. I really liked it. I know most people come for the fried chicken (which my husband ordered and it was great) but be open to the roasted chicken if you feel you need something lighter - you will not be disappointed.   The ambience is cool. Lots of grey shiplap interior. With sort of an old timey feel. Very clean. There is a cool exterior area that I would love to be seated in next time I'm there.   Overall-I was really pleased with our experience and I look forward to our return.

gA4jEMwPMTrUNyhNNqi5ng.text: Service was horrible from our original waiter she caught an attitude about me sending my drink that had something in it back, she took forever to come bring our other drinks out, she skipped over us numerous of times to the point we asked for someone else to service us.

BVq9qkSU2zlJ1e-NBjFZ5w.text: Yikes. Visited after a few recommendations from folks around town. Off bat, our server had an attitude. It was obvious that she was more than ready to go home. Then our appetizer was luke warm and just okay -- ordered the biscuits with bacon jam. Got the fried chicken for the entree. My dark meat was good (nothing to write home about) but my boyfriend's white meat wasn't fully fried and the breading was mushy. And the mac and cheese isn't stringy cheesy but saucy cheesy, if you're into that. Best part was the banana pudding. Not sure if we caught an off night, but if I come back, it won't have been my first choice.

dUa7CPtH5A3YpGkhmlrJ8w.text: This place was amazing! It's a beautiful restaurant with a good drink menu and delicious food. We started with the deviled eggs, house made pickles, and hush puppies, all really good. Then has chicken tenders, creamed kale grits, and the mac and cheese. Everything was shareable so and portioned perfectly for two people. Our server was awesome! No bad recs. The drinks are good too!!

xViMsqWBxcjUsS4D7qJH0A.text: Wow!!!  Loved the trout!  Probably one of the best we have ever eaten!  They had really good chicken and waffles too. The waffle was a bit heavy though.   Drinks were amazing!   You won't regret this place if you stop here!!!

3fvedJu3F8ujDjdEvrm_-w.text: Delicious charred okra, banana pudding, and brunch.  I dig the family style menu. Pretty good chicken.   Skip the over-priced cocktails.

aO9w12RCUQ3D8JkOo-prFQ.text: This is one of our favorite spots in NoDa! It has been our go to since we moved to Charlotte when it comes to deciding on a quick date night. The food has never disappointed us, and the service has always been amazing. The alabama white sauce tossed with the baked chicken is drool worthy. I highly recommend the mac and cheese with chicken skins. But really, you can't go wrong with anything on their menu, I've pretty much tried it all. If you're going with a group of people, split a punch bowl, it'll save you some serious $ on drinks. My only complaint here (if any) is the drinks. They tend to put a ton of ice in your glass, and give you a small portion of alcohol. Their drinks are refreshing but somewhat syrupy. Other than that, 10/10 we always recommend Haberdish to friends!

gZEKVb3Fqhia_LJQHEcFyw.text: This place is amazing! We decided to give Haberdish a try on a Sunday around 9:30PM, so it wasn't too busy. Waitress was friendly and made sure we had everything we needed.   I had a few simple, but not so simple dishes. Macaroni and cheese with crispy chicken skins. It was absolutely delicious. I also had the pimeno cheese ball with spiced pecans. It was served with thin sliced apples and crackers, also amazing.   I was very satisfied with the service, food and the overall experience Haberdish had to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and cheese with spicy, crispy chicken skins.
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimeno cheese ball was delicious. The spiced pecans gave it a really nice consistency.

zAMkomtjYTxE-dmTw-hlJA.text: Great food. Pretty good value when being strategic. Ordering single chicken tenders and then adding an app worked pretty well for my group. The pickles are amazing, however, we ordered them by accident. We thought they were fried (as most apps featuring pickles) but they were just cold classics. Still very good.

KkTdjRusKQ6OoKfZEND-ZQ.text: Winner Winner  Haberdish Dinner  I've been to Haberdish once and I fall in love right away. It really lives up to the hype, and it became one of my few favorite spots in Charlotte. If you haven't been yet, make haste! It's time to prepare your loose-fitting pants for an incredible Restaurant.  Some of Foodful info:  - HABERDISH: Haberdashery + Dish. - Great service (southern hospitality). Friendly and attentive waitress (shoutout to Jillian.)  - Bright, airy space and welcoming ambiance. - Deviled eggs, chicken tenders, mac & cheese and okra. One of the best (and interesting) brunches I've had in a while. -  The Waffel Sundae. Insanely delicious. Dessert for breakfast, anyone? - The ice. Oh, the ice. Fresh flower inside a perfect sphere of ice for your drink - selected drinks. - Closed on Mondays. Chicken & Biscuit Night on Fridays. Chicken & Waffles all day on Sundays. - Haberdish don't take advance reservations, however, you can see the current wait time with the "Nowait app."  Five Yelps

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

8yFJgKT5hzUIrlkNq7v8NA.text: A classic choice in NoDa, but beware the busy hours. After getting water, I waited almost 30 minutes for the server to come take my order. Very kind staff, but be ready to order the minute you get seated. The waffles are delicious, though I thought the sugar cubes in it was unnecessary; too sweet for my taste. Their chicken, however, is the best I've had in a very long time.

DBvMCrPhBTLh3jMO_vOlCA.text: Haberdish is one of my favorite spots in Noda.  The fried chicken, macaroni and cheese, kale salad, hush puppies and banana pudding are my favorite dishes! The cocktail program is pretty amazing as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enjoyed drinks last night! This beauty is the Dubbinnet Flip!
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drinks and food are amazing here!

IaAFcDiPsGj2mZcfHJqY1A.text: Oh my goodness... I think I'll be dreaming about this fried chicken for the rest of my life. We LOVE this place. My favorite thing to do here is to come as a foursome and eat family style (which is also their recommendation). We get one whole fried chicken and 3 sides and it's more than enough to leave us all FULL and HAPPY. :)   Last time we got the livermush appetizer on toast which was good, but a little small for a shared appetizer. We got the whole chicken and our 3 sides were the kale salad, the macaroni and cheese (with the added fried chicken skin crumbles on top, of course) and the sweet potato dumplings. They were all delicious.  The cocktail game is also on point here. I love their mules. They do a solid Moscow Mule and Kentucky Mule (with bourbon).   And, at the end of the night, we didn't have sticker shock on our bill due to the fair pricing and family style eats. We'll be back for many double date nights or friend groups to come.

mGow4fOXjGf0AnQBJYwTAQ.text: So I had to update my review, because now at this point, I've eaten about half the menu over the course of about five visits.  I completely stand by the Cocktails.  OUTSTANDING.  This is absolutely a place where you don't have to run to your favorite beer as a safe choice.  I'm still completely obsessed with the flower filled ice balls.  As good as some of the cocktails are at the bars in NoDa, this little detail is a nice touch to make the drinks stand out.  As for the food, absolutely yes to the fried chicken.  I also tasted the chicken tenders again and they were moist with less breading (MUCH better than the first time I was here).  The real winner of my visits though was the Chicken & Biscuit special during the week.  If you like chicken pot pie (seriously, who doesn't love chicken pot pie?!?!), you need to order this dish.  The Mac has always been a bit salty (which is my speed), so you may want to order some veggies to offset the sodium intake.  I'm glad I continue to come back here, because it gets better each time.  Service has always been a little slow, so be prepared to come in and relax with some friends and have a casual meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. 20th century cocktail is delicious!
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken gravy and biscuits with kale salad and mac

fkr4vD7rLywS0pl_MVxqdw.text: Want to love this place...but it's starting to slip. Starting with the decor--tables are weirdly sticky on top, and one of the metal chair backs bent backwards when my partner sat in it. The waitress just shrugged and said "yeah they've been known to do that." Whaaaat?! Didn't make my 73 year old mother feel too safe. Craft cocktails are inspired, so kudos there. Food Menu is very limited (prompting our out of town guests to ask if "that was it"-yikes!), which is okay if the food is always exemplary--it's not. The deviled eggs are always good. The cauli-steak with chimichurri is *usually* good, but inconsistent. Mac and cheese....depends on the day. Roasted chicken and fish are usually okay. Just expect a little better than what they've been putting out the last three visits...not enticed to go back any time soon.

5CxhoRWEfjQ-O2VmPbdSBw.text: I loved this experience! I did so much researching before we came to Charlotte on the best spots to go and this one was at the top of many lists. I LOVED the vibe here, both the indoor and outdoor seating were nice and it just felt so trendy. We came early and were second in a long line and by noon this place was packed.  Cocktails: I got the spiked pineapple cocktail, which could be skipped, go for the instagram worthy mint julep instead. If something is supposed to have jalapenos I want to taste that spice and this one lacked (just tasted of pineapples and no cool flower in my drink either).  Food: We split a bunch of stuff which I thought was the way to go. You can skip the deviled eggs, they were good but nothing out of this world. I would definitely order the hush puppies and the biscuits, but the stars of the entire meal were the chicken tenders and the corn bread pudding. That fried chicken was some of the best I've ever had and the corn bread pudding was such an unexpected pleasant surprise. It had a perfect char and the combination with the gruyere cheese was amazing. Awesome spot in NoDa! I'm coming back for that mint julep!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits, chicken tenders and corn bread pudding=get all of these things
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. cute&amp;clean
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. coolvibesss

NfORV-Uym1IPnYawutHEug.text: Great cocktails, delicious food, and great service. Beautiful NoDa restaurant with an attractive decor and perfect location. Highly recommend.

XcGqkrUUvZFiP88M7HRbKw.text: The best fried chicken I have ever had. My boyfriend and I always split a half fried chicken and two different sides. The price is extremely reasonable for what we get, and for the quality of the food. They have a great atmosphere as well. I've been here a few times now and we never leave disappointed. We even brought my parents and they hate eating out, but they admitted that it was one of the best experiences and food they have had.

Ubg0F7aDL8ewA3q1eW5keQ.text: Can't understand what all the good reviews are about.  Chicken was good but the batter was meh.  The tator tots were terrible; cold slaw was good.  my biggest complaints were really crappy service and the lemon tart desert was pitifully small, especially for $7.00.  I don't live here but I would not come back.

BgLdqS27Zl85_Sxjd4RvCA.text: You.  Must. Go. Here.  I had the ever-elusive experience of a food-rection last night, and I will not be seeing a medical professional if it last longer than 4 hours.  Hush Puppies - Yes.  Smoked Chicken - Hell yes.  Sweet Potato Dumplings - F**k Yes.  Okra w/ Bacon relish - Howard Dean-style 'Byaaaaa!!!!'

HevoBYZ0n4lG_VA9Rz3_ZQ.text: Best fried chicken in the world!! I loved my meal so much that whenever I get to choose where to dine, this is my choice. My husband got the ranch chicken and didn't like his at all. You can't go wrong with the fried chicken though and the biscuits are so delicious too!

kvyVZHyxRWd-c5ixStwWlg.text: My parents and I came here for brunch last Sunday. We shared fried chicken, biscuits with bacon jam, deviled eggs, livermush toast, okra with more bacon jam, and cole slaw. Everything was fantastic except for the livermush toast; all the condiments were unable to disguise the unpleasant flavor of the livermush. I suspect this is something no one likes unless they grew up eating it. In general, this was easily the best brunch I've had in Charlotte.

XIJchxUAUy_nmHN08mCHVw.text: I tried this place on a whim with a friend after hearing about it recently opening. From the outside it definitely has a great look to pique your curiosity to want to go inside.  Once inside we were not disappointed with anything from the decor (copper vs. silverware, so cool), the ambience, our fantastic waiter, the food, and the prices.  For reference we ordered the sweet potato dumplings, kale salad, deviled eggs, and cole slaw, and split the waffle for dessert (OMG the waffle with the buttermilk ice cream all completely homemade and amazing!!!!).  Highly recommend this place despite the parking being a pain around there but it's worth it!

ce3wEbwpMDK7Qendq15ChQ.text: Haberdish is my new favorite restaurant in Charlotte. It is (dangerously) close to my house, and we've been visiting on a weekly basis since they opened. The food and cocktails are always exceptional, the ambiance/vibe is perfect, and all the servers are super friendly. Must trys: chicken, okra, tater tots, mac n cheese, and well the whole menu really. I can't say enough good things about Haberdish!

wWv_4UU2QlpFbVVsluaoMg.text: Amazing craft cocktails. Just what CLT needs. Wishing you would open a Huntersville location. love the bartenders!!

QQQ6_t-D6x1cHt3GOF0Cmw.text: This place is awesome!! The food and drinks are phenomenal, the service is friendly and quick, and the atmosphere is the perfect balance of hillbilly-chic that is popular but hard to achieve these days! I recommend the Red Flower cocktail, Deviled Eggs and Hushpuppies for apps, and the Roasted Chicken entree with Roasted Okra side dish - but honestly any choices made at this establishment are great ones!

aigVVW3qjBsejNKSvZNIow.text: Loved the food and atmosphere! Grateful for the vegetarian menu and the waitstaff is very nice! I had cauliflower steak and the Mac and cheese! It was GREAT!

NCh0FPsinnRki3HwZC7MyQ.text: finally went here to eat to see what all the hype was about and i was disappointed. the best thing here is the chicken. the mac and cheese was horrible once it got cold it was worst. not sure i would go back here

N0XoYgfQzFer2MjZs_PSBg.text: This place is super nice inside scenery is great. The wait staff is really good full of personality. Their drink menu as expected is very good. The place is new so the food needs a little help to be 5 star. The fried chicken and pork is good the sides need some help especially the Brussel sprout salad it was really bad. The Ocre also needs so additional flavor.

Pvyv7u0LvERYfFqQ_9XTgw.text: I have lived in Charlotte for a couple of years now and have been wanting to visit this place for a while now, so last Sunday my mom and I came for brunch and sat outside. Everything was amazing it was such a nice day out we had some mimosas and ordered quite a bit off the menu just to try as much as we could, our server was excellent, he explained the menu well and how the portion sizes worked which was very helpful. I had seen photos of the food on instagram and that made the anticipation of getting our meals even more. I was thrilled when our food came out looking exactly like the photos and wasn't just a nice look for the pictures (that's rare) the Mac and cheese was amazing we got the fried chicken skins on top and when it came out it had a spicy sauce on top and it was INCREDIBLE our server even gave us some to go! Everyone in Charlotte should be regulars here! It was outstanding!!! I love NoDa more and more now, keep it up guys thanks for making our visit so awesome!

l121NO23fGXvSz1rZzYlEg.text: The food and service are amazing. We had a hard time picking what to eat; everything looked delicious!! Our waitress was very attentive and quick to help with suggestions. The only drawback is they don't take reservations - but you can use an app called No Wait to "get in line". Atmosphere is cozy, fun and kid friendly.

yuH-1R02SKQipoFZd87_zQ.text: EAT AT THE BAR! Eat only apps. Drink the good drinks. Waited 2.5 hours for ok food.

Aca1lnXUJwH1DBx_zgGPfw.text: Great take on southern cuisine. Our favorite is the chicken tenders. Great sides. It's a neat place and their chicken is amazing. Atmosphere is really cool. Been a few times and always enjoy it.

GhbhOpmKJyrOmPI5jJYmKg.text: We went on a date night last week. We used the no wait app and put our name on the list. We ordered several different things off of the menu. The portions are tapas style. Cocktails were great but on the small side. The place is super cute but can be noisy since it's one large room.

LV_OnukETSlMi4L0fYKQYw.text: Welcome to NoDa! First of all, the space is modern and clean. The waitstaff is friendly. Now the food... There are some serious hits here. The fried chicken is delicious and that habanero hot sauce is a must try if you like spicy food. Don't let "habanero" scare you away though, it's not that spicy. The batter on the chicken has great seasoning and a slight touch of sweetness. The kale grits were creamy and perfectly cooked -- tender but not seized. Now, there was a miss, the smoked deviled eggs -- those were not my favorite. By the time they are boiled and deviled then smoked, the egg white was rubbery and unpleasant. However, if you like pickles, they seem to always have at least a couple types on their menu at any given time. I always order them both. My friends really loved the pimento cheese - I wasn't wowed by it, I thought it was a bit under-seasoned, but I thought it was still pretty good. Now for the drinks -- I find they make a very nice drink, but their cocktail menu hangs out on the sugary side of the spectrum.

SA4pk_rWU1iWRNnK6W1c1g.text: Great restaurant!  I had been seeing this restaurant all over social media so I was really interested to see if it was actually worth the hype or just another trendy Charlotte restaurant with high prices and mediocre food. Very glad to report that the food was delicious and the prices actually aren't that bad (besides the drinks)!   We were immediately sat on a Wednesday night around 8.  Still a happening place, but not overly crowded. Really nice atmosphere with simple industrial decor. We ordered the Mac and cheese, two tenders, kale salad, hush puppies, and deviled eggs.  We got all the small plates and it was plenty of food for us to feel satisfied.  I really liked it all, but was most surprised about how good the kale salad ended up being.  With so many other unhealthy/delicious options it was a bit hard to order kale, but it was super great with goat cheese and some delicious crunchy topping.  I'm of the mindset that Mac and cheese and fried chicken are always good, but I do think theirs may be above average.  The Mac and cheese was super creamy and the honey mustard for the chicken was amazing!  Deviled eggs were good, but as a deviled egg connoisseur, I do feel that they could have used a little more spice or something to help them not be as basic.    Only complaint would probably be the price of the drinks.  We got two drinks and the drinks almost ended up being the same price of our entire meal when we got our bill.  I got the red flower which I wouldn't recommend as it is just basically a small glass of champagne with a flower in it.  I only ordered it bc I thought it was going to have this fancy ice flower in it that I saw on Instagram, but I was sadly mistaken.  Apparently you have to ask for the fancy ice flower (next time I will be prepared!!).  Overall it would be nice if they had some cheaper drink options or at least drink specials like most restaurant do during the week, but I do plan on going back and can't wait to try the okra and cauliflower.  Oh, and for brunch!

DjoT3q9v3YPE_FCTO5KNTA.text: Love love love this place! The kale salad is amazing, I'm also obsessed with the cauliflower steak!  The drinks are well priced and delicious! One of my favorite brunch spots around.

0baVKdZrwjOpEb7_Av1weg.text: Great place! Environment was awesome. Food is eclectic and very good. This is not a cheap place be prepared to spend some dollars. Drinks were expensive as well. All in all a great experience

JWYRxQafsV7y3FXz8hPzPA.text: This place is way overhyped. I was on the waiting list for one hour and was expecting a call or text of when my table would be ready. It passed our time and never sent a text or call. When I went up to the desk they said that they took off my name and wasn't sure why. As we sat down, the workers stared at me and my friends a lot. We ordered and waited an extra hour. The fried chicken that everyone seems to enjoy was not good. Super "crunchy" and "crisp" is not always good with fried chicken. Place isn't too expensive but food tasted salty and burnt. Wasn't a fan

CffgobXfpnpWLelkUI39sg.text: Service was awesome, and food was delicious! Definitely one of my favorite spots in Charlotte!

a0c96ESORjLTH7nELL2VYQ.text: I have been dying to try this place since it opened because I have only heard good things and this past weekend I finally got my chance. My dad and I were wrapping up some Christmas shopping and noticed there was no line for lunch!   My dad and I popped in and were instantly hungry by all the amazing smells filling the restaurant. Most note worthy were the multiple plates of fried chicken leaving the kitchen.   The menu is on the smaller side, but everything on it they are doing right!. We ordered the mac and cheese (with the hot sauce and fried chicken skins on top), the hot side of the day - collard greens, fried chicken, and ribs. Yes our eyes were bigger than our stomachs. Everything we ordered was the definition of comfort food. The mac and cheese was delightful with the kick from the hot sauce and the crunch from the chicken skins, the collard greens were in my dad's opinion the best EVER, and the ribs were smoky and fall off the bone. But the STAR of the event was the fried chicken! Crispy, salty outside and juicy, tender on the inside, some of the best fried chicken I have ever had and I was raised in the South.   In addition to the delicious food, they have craft cocktails and beers on tap. My dad got the founder's stout which was aged in oak barrels and so creamy smooth and I got the holiday Moscow mule which was a fun twist on one of my favorite cocktails.   We are looking forward to going back when my brother is in town!

UV3UJc8sG6LnWN1zKy8Xlg.text: I was so excited to finally go to Haberdish because I've heard so many great things about it and I have to say it mostly lived up to the hype. My husband and I went on a Thursday night and still had to wait at least 45 minutes, so pretty safe to say no matter when you go, be prepared to wait. Even with a packed house, our waitress was very attentive and gave great service.   We started with the pimento cheese ball and the house pickles for appetizers. I wasn't wowed by either of these, neither were bad but I've definitely had better pimento cheese in charlotte. The cheese ball was covered in pecans and had a chipotle taste to it, just wasn't my style. For dinner I got the two piece fried  chicken (all white meat) and my husband got the chicken fingers. The chicken was fantastic! It had great seasoning and the tenders were so big that two were more than enough for a meal. For sides we got mac and cheese and the pickled coleslaw which were both also amazing. The coleslaw was so different from anywhere else I have had before.   Overall the food was great, so don't let the long wait deter you.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

n6JT32o9yEe0aTrs0nGZbA.text: Fantastic food and cocktails, the kind of place that brings the whole neighborhood together and becomes a real destination in its own right.

corz-T8gmdZdFvauS6cz9A.text: One of my favorite little spots to eat. Great service and great food. The food is rich and heavy so it's a great splurge for those health conscious

0uVqiV0zd_rBy_jJ-ivOzw.text: We met some friends in Charlotte recently and wanted to try a new spot of course. She sent me a list of 6 places, we chose Haberdish. The pics and reviews were so enticing. It was an excellent choice. I will admit, I was taken aback by the small menu. But that shows confidence, and they have a little something to be confident about.  We ordered hush puppies for the table - and then we ordered another round. They were so so so good.  I went off the rails with my order, I had liver mush toast and a side of okra. Most of my friends know I love ordering from the appetizer menu, I'm not sure why - but I do. My husband had the smoked chicken. And we ordered macaroni for the little one. Disclaimer - The only reason we order her a meal is because it came with milk. It's usually a waste of money because she eats our food. She did not eat the mac and cheese, but my husband ate it. Our friends ordered the half fried chicken, kale grits, the mac and cheese with bacon crumbles. I tasted the grits. They were ssoooo good. My mouth is starting to water right now, hmm go figure.  Also, I love the decor and feel of this restaurant (just had to throw that in).  Would I try this place again, absolutely. Would I recommend it, also-freakin-lately, oh and I have recommended it several times.  Sorry, I completely forgot to say - great wait staff!!!  Parking is tight in the NoDa area. But it's still worth the trip. Besides once you find a space you should just walk around and enjoy it.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Macaroni
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked chicken
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hush puppies

jKWljw0iv7YXzNIZxxrt1A.text: Tough and oily sweet potato dumplings... below average Mac ... tons of pepper and a wimpy cheese sauce, good hush puppies, but not great, corn pudding bland and oily... coffee burned.  I ate little.  Disappointed. Perhaps it was leftover Tuesday and their game was off bc there sure are a lot of fantastic reviews.

4aLcweh6KCtOj4fFReFbqA.text: Thanks to Yelpers, we decided to come to Noda and see the area. Came on Sunday Superbowl Sunday around 12. There was no wait and got seated immediately. It was a rough night so we couldn't wait to fill up on fried chicken. Ordered half, Mac n cheese with the skin, kale salad and the corn bread pudding. Fried chicken had lots of flavors, meat was still juicy. I loved the kale salad. I had it all to myself. Mac n cheese was good. We could have gone without the corn bread. It was on the drier side. The price was very reasonable.   I love the decor. It reminded of fixer upper of HGTV. The serving dishes are a bit vintage and they have these amazing barn doors. Southern chic at its finest.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn bread and Mac n cheese with crispy chicken skin
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kale salad and 1/2 fried chicken

0oa8ab9lVlhUbFnh-6y3TQ.text: Finally came here for an early dinner yesterday and it was amazing. The vibe of the restaurant is excellent, with a very nice bar. I had the two piece fried chicken and charred okra. Both were excellent. The bacon jam was rich, and not greasy. It was a deliciously indulgent meal that didn't leave you with a fried food "hangover". Our server was nice and the experience overall was great. I'll definitely return in the future!

q5oScMBp0gQoUDkMckzDMw.text: This is the best fried chicken house, low country, southern, a la carte selection I have EVER been too. I'm a chef in Charleston, SC; there are more southern restaurants than I could describe; I am from Charlotte originally and I knew after I read the menu, I just had to go. How proud I was to see Haberdish, rep Anson Mills!   I seriously have no idea what the comment is about "don't get the Mac and cheese" I had the chorizo Mac and cheese and it was, simply amazing. I got the livermush toast, (OMG the cornbread pudding!!!!!) the deviled eggs and the beignet like hush puppies that were awesome, the collards with what seemed to be osso boco broth, because of the delicious pork jus like liquid in those collards were out of this world. Everything was amazing, I wanted to cry in Joy, so proud to be a southerner and a chef and get completely blown away by the passion and simplicity of the restaurant, $12 for a half chicken!!!!!? The fried chicken made anything I've ever eaten before, seem like a pile of mud. In other words, the BEST fried chicken I have ever had. Thank you, thank you, please don't open another store, haha, crown and jewel! Simply.... AWEsome!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chorizo, fried chicken skin Mac and cheese... Nuff said.
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Livermush Toast... Free your.. mind!
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken Heaven, you can see wig your own eyes, it&#39;s got that crunch you crave!

TMj5hui02gcAGD1S2i7xTQ.text: Food tastes great. Service and ambiance is good. Great place to eat out with family on a Saturday.

WMU8K2JvREayie4y_u2dKQ.text: First, here's what has to happen to get at ***** review.   * Staff is uneven. Some care, some don't. Waitress for the evening disappeared without a word to go home. Had to ask bartender for check ... which she processed with a great attitude. Welcome was underwhelming for a party of four, all above age 65. We had a total of four waiters plus a runner. Attending to the table was poor with us twice getting up from the table to ask for more wine, for example. Checking backing with the table was unacceptable with large times between even asking if we were ready to order. * Wine prices are double full retail or more. This is unacceptable. The Jordan Chardonnay can be found in stores for around $30-32; their price was $70. Since this is more of a bar than a restaurant, and since their wine list is so very small -- though nicely chosen -- I would not visit again with wine drinkers. We chose the Stellina Pinot Gringio (2 bottles) and the Jordan Chardonnay. * It seems that they are, in part, chef driven. The "Biscuits & Jam" had to be replaced because the biscuits were too hard to eat! This should not have been served! I actually took my knife and banged on the biscuit before it was removed! However, the deviled eggs are spectacular and recommended. The pimento cheese ball was also a hit. These are, of course, perfect bar food items and not restaurant appetizers but "snacks" as listed on the menu. Another favorite was the Liver Mush Toast. I asked if it was Neese's (a local provider less than one mile away), and the waitress was unsure. It was recommended by the clean plate, though. * The two entrees came with nothing ... that's nothing! No bread, no waffles, no nothing; all was a la carte. The pan fried trout was well cooked but a bit salty. The fried chicken was crunchy beyond belief; it makes KFC Extra Crispy seem soggy. For my taste, this experience reminded me of crunching ice, and the herbs in the copious breading gave an odd sense of burnt (which it wasn't) frying. For real Southern fried chicken, I suggest changing the breading to something traditional and frying in one of your cast iron skillets and not in a deep fryer. Also, the Anson Mills grits with kale is just plain weird, It reminded me of Irish steel-cut oats. BTW, I am an Anson Mills customer, just so you know. * The banana pudding was a huge hit.  If you're looking for a neighborhood bar with aspirations of "sports" and the loud pop music that often accompanies, and you're hungry for good bar food, this would be a fine choice. The care that is taken with the food is uneven (yes, I observed the kitchen) and it depends on when you come and the age of your party; young, energetic tables seem to attract the most attention. In some ways, this is understandable, but it in others it is just stupid. Our table of four old guys dropped an over $200 tab while the table of four cute girls next over spent a total of $55. 'nuff said?

HkZohwX6JAv_UfoNjGybaw.text: Great cocktail selection and menu! Bartenders could have been more engaging. Really enjoyed the atmosphere.

Mna998lpdbdI8iLrZSruaA.text: Everything on their menu is delicious. If you're looking for a twist on traditional southern food, this place is it!

GSZvXTVS-cINaFKrZbjw4Q.text: Is everyone else drinking the Kool-Aid? The fella and I made a special trip to NoDa from Fort Mill to hit Haberdish, and we got there 2 minutes after they opened. There were already two groups at the bar and three groups seated; apparently this is the hot ticket in town.  I loved the atmosphere - twinkling lights, a magical bar, cozy lighting, and massive, wooden garage doors that open up to the outdoor patio on nice days. There are two unobtrusive TVs over the bar so you can keep up with the games, too.  We started with the pimento cheese ball ($9). We were hoping for a good, Southern pimento cheese, but it was a little sweet and didn't have much of a kick. It was rolled in pecans and served with Granny Smith apple slices and crackers. Huh.  For dinner, I got the fried chicken tenders($2.50 per)  and sweet potato dumplings ($4). The chicken tenders were pretty bland, but the honey mustard cleared my sinuses. When the dumplings didn't look like dumplings, I asked the waitress about it... she said they mistakenly brought the bread pudding. She left the bread pudding and brought dumplings. Ironically enough, I liked the bread pudding better. The dumplings were covered in Parmesan cheese, so they lost all sweetness I was expecting from sweet potatoes.  The fella got the fried chicken ($6 leg and thigh), and he said it was pretty bland, too. He got the macaroni and cheese as a side ($4), and although it was cheesy, it was pretty thin. I like a thick, hearty cheese, so perhaps that's just an opinion thing?  Our waitress Marnie was nice enough, but it took so long to get a drink that we almost canceled our order. Apparently the bartenders bring the drinks, not the waiters, but when we asked where our drink was, she said, "Oh, that comes from the bar." Ummm, could you maybe check on it?  Man, I hate that we had such a blah experience because I was SO excited to try Haberdish. Thankfully, Crepe Cellar is right next door.

t6VnFmSBDO-LEdycwBKXOw.text: Amazing food all the way around. Definitely check this place out.  The fried chicken and Mac and cheese is delicious. The okra is literally the best I've ever had.

UIe3S-Nt36flvZkvsBOzYQ.text: I came for brunch one Sunday afternoon, and thanks to Yelp, I reserved a spot in line before walking through the door. Our wait ended up being about 10 minutes! The menu was sparse, not sure if that is just a Sunday brunch menu thing or if it's always like that. But it worked out great because the fewer options means that they specialize in certain items...and less indecisiveness from me. We ordered the half fried chicken, brussel sprouts, the sweet potato dumplings and the okra. Everything tasted fresh and satisfying! It was a little greasy, but what else do you expect from a southern restaurant. Haberdish is definitely a good place to come with a few people so you can order a couple of side dishes and sample everything.

_vQr0tZKiR2yWPkxqxJ_Og.text: Haberdish needs no more reviews, but what the heck! Delicious: smoked deviled eggs, liver mush toast, a chicken leg broth soup, the chicken, it's all delicious. Just go :)

wLhPrIMXS9d_TGUSa2WuGw.text: I like it because the macaroni cheese taste good they got cotton candy and  so go there now and my name is Demani

w2Ap350hZGHmGsYXUy8SPA.text: I know the wait can be long but oh is it worth it! The staff is quite friendly and knowledgeable. The food is what brings me back time and time again (not to mention the creative cocktails!). The cauliflower steak is perfectly seasoned and can't be missed. The chicken tenders are by far the best I've had (try the white hot sauce with them). The King cocktail uses a sous vide to be created?! Seriously. They care about their creations.   The leadership is doing something right. And we'll keep coming back for it!

ylrg9T_0nT9-2ig61c9mYA.text: Felt compelled to review because it's been a while since every bite of my meal (and the other's at my table) was excellent. Had the chicken tenders, pickles, deviled eggs, and cast iron okra. The hostess wasn't the warmest, but our server was kind and helpful. If I could have, I'd have bought a whole jar of the pickles.
