9Bp2ohDZqWjw_R7Ae_BhLQ.text: My husband thinks the food is ok I think that I tried it and don't have to go again service was great atmosphere was great food not so great also the chairs are not for anyone who has any type of back side very uncomfortable if you have hips or a butt

NaH8GBy8JG1oABsWkfH0kA.text: I like Haberdish quite a bit! Parking in Noda can be tricky but its worth it. The service has always been great, the food top notch, and the drinks are ok. I take people from out of town here for some good southern food.

JUtPmg9YtN2Ub--nl0kcXQ.text: Four stars for the ambience. 3.5 for the food. Service was average during busy dinner. Nice place to take a date if you are looking to dine outdoors. Their outdoor eating area has a motorized ceiling that adjusts depending on how much sunlight is out. More shade during high sun and more open during dusk and evening. Food for me didn't really stand out.

kX__Y6Nwlrfr7whf7kehSA.text: A promising spot located in trendy NoDa with an industrial modern feel to it with exposed brick and wooden tables.  We tried to use the NoWait app to get in line when we were on our way, but the app said there was no wait.  Then did not update (despite refreshing) which meant when we arrived we were disappointed there was a 30 min wait.  We decided to wait at the bar.  We ordered drinks - which were OK - and a couple dishes (one of which never arrived).  More than an hour later - 77 minutes to be exact - we still were not seated, the host did not say anything and wasn't that sympathetic to my disappointment in the wait.  It was made worse when another (large) party arrived and were seated almost immediately (ahead of us). When we were seated someone came by and dropped a few appetizers on the table - not knowing what they were, looking perplexed - someone eventually explained they were on the house and what they were. The food was hit or miss.  The hush puppies were fresh and probably the best I've ever had.  The ribs had a good smokey flavor, but they weren't very tender.  The mac n' cheese - my go to side - left something to be desired. All in all, not worth going for another long wait, but it had a lot of potential.

w76jkPmm_z92eg5ikhv4sw.text: Best place on the block hands down. Cocktails, chicken fingers (yes chicken fingers!), and darn near everything I've tried on that menu is phenomenal!!!! Try the ribs, try the Mac and cheese but make sure to add the chicken skins too it and if you like it spicy use the sauce on the table! I think I just talked myself into dinner!

wjRvDnKTQkn5yUi4_39U5Q.text: You can't go wrong with anything on the menu here. Everything is absolutely amazing. The chicken is perfect, the sides are delicious and fun, and the drinks are perfect.

mqTlhfUa-juUg5KH7-8vIw.text: BEST hush puppies you will ever have. Anything fried at this place is a home run. Also, the drinks are pricey, but well worth it.

7GxJUOeb-drTgHQAicMX4A.text: The food is ok, let's just say their appetizers and sides are the best things they have on their menu. The guy host is great, but as for our server...can't say the same. Sadly to say I won't be back. Foster and last time.

O0KGkObluq-wBkcaS0Ax5w.text: My husband and I had dinner at Haberdish on Dec 21 and loved it! We are big fans of the Crepe Cellar, and couldn't wait to try Jeff Tonidandel's newest restaurant. My husband had the pork shank, which was smokey and tasty, but would have liked for it to be served with a sauce to keep the meat moist. The macaroni and cheese was rich and delicious but not what he expected. He assumed it would be a baked dish, but this was more like a pasta with cream sauce. I had the trout and okra, both of which were outstanding. The menu is limited, and we were surprised there was no main dish of beef. We loved the ambiance and lighting of the restaurant. The service was spot on, friendly, warm, and helpful. We'll be back!

qpVyHgHV7WIt00bNqcuhZA.text: First time eating here. I loved it. Atmosphere, wait staff and food was great. We will go back. We liked everything we ordered. Plates are shareable so order a variety share with table. Nice cocktail choices too. Go early due to popularity they are busy. They don't take reservations.

qVFd5g1PCqXAYaSTS_8SjA.text: Cool concept using real thermos for coffee!  Had a cool hipster vibe lots of young professional types the breakfast was incredible but really how can you go wrong with fried chicken and waffles!  My guests loved it also !

2g7B4NpCKc2bgqxJAS6GAw.text: NOT IMPRESSED  FIRST LET ME START WITH THE SERVICE. IT WAS GOOD. NO COMPLAINTS REALLY. WENT ON A SAT MORNING AT 11. They only serve brunch during the week never on Saturdays and Sundays. That was fine. I ordered the blonde Bloody Mary. It was ok. Had the chicken and waffles with their sweet tea butter. Let's start with the sweet tea butter. They could have kept it. I didn't taste the tea. Just the sweetness. The waffle was already sweat but not in a normal waffle way. It just wasn't that good. I got a breast and a wing with the waffle and the chicken was actually fried perfectly and it was juicy, however it was the type where the batter doesn't stay on the chicken that well. It separates and I just don't like it. It was tasty tho. And the house habanero sauce was pleasant. The price was nice. And the atmosphere was cool they were playing all neo soul like Erykah Badu and D'Angelo. It was a cool vibe but I doubt if I will go back.

2A7snO8Dchp0bPvxer5bow.text: Great food. Patrick was amazing, awesome service and very timely. Awesome vibe. Will be back for sure!

L-TK9Schs-l1J7DhTbY1wQ.text: I got the biscuit and sausage gravy which was more than what I thought it would be.  It was very good and was bursting with flavor.  Their chicken and waffles that my boyfriend got was amazing!  I never was turned into chicken and waffles until I've had this one.  I also loved the cinnamon biscuit.  You determine how much sweetness you want to put on it and it's so nice and flaky!

wD5fZohjwsB4sGive8-bAQ.text: Drinks were good especially the knobb creek and usually I drink tequll. Limited menu but EVERYTHING  WAS AWESOME.OKRA OKRA OKRA. Bartenders were great. Everyone was attentive. Mac n cheese was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

DtjQpOc0_aaYdb2VD0uTHA.text: Well, come to Charlotte and expect good comfort food, well thank you Haberdish for making this a reality.  We enjoyed our last dinner here and boy was it great. The atmosphere at Haberdish is comfy and sophisticated, once again walking distance to our homebase in Noda. I can't believe how much good food was walking distance from our place.  Haberdish really delivered on the comfort food, with a small menu. When you see a small menu, sometimes it is a bad sign, but many times, a great sign - they have really mastered their art in the form of these foods, choose and be happy.   In this case, the center of the menu was fried chicken, so it was a no-brainer for me - I LOVE fried chicken. This particular fried chicken was everything you would want, it was perfectly portioned, crispy, the right amount of salty, and yet still juicier than the world, inside. I will put this as the top five fried chicken dishes I have had the pleasure to enjoy.   The mac and cheese was fine, nothing to write home about but a good accompaniment. The biscuits with bacon and jam were excellent, a great balance between sweet and salty, on top of flaky and buttery. I might say the biscuits were a bit doughy, but honestly I would be nit-picking at this point.  Overall, a great meal, served by an excellent waiter.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits with bacon and a sweet sauce
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good Mac
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Perfectly cooked fried chicken.

diJ_Ith9mgxG7z-iXapn4A.text: I had high expectations for Haberdish. Unfortunately I want to give this restaurant more than four stars.   Most of the food was actually really good! We went for brunch and I got the chicken and waffles, devil eggs, and cheese straws. The chicken was a great choice because it was moist and very tender. You could cut through it with no problem. I really enjoyed their homemade hot sauce as well.   However, The service was not the best. I believe we got a interesting server who was awkward and not very personable. Is common nature to approach people and have open body language and not stand behind them and ask for their order. I am sure other servers are much more attentive.   I guess I was expecting food that would make me want to come back to this place over and over again but I honestly can't say I'm rushing back to go here for brunch . Nevertheless , I will definitely give it another try but not for brunch. I think I will stick with lunch or dinner here.   I believe that the side items on their brunch menu actually would have been fantastic. I believe the menu is too limited for brunch and they need more traditional brunch items.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese Straws.
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Devil eggs
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles

hOwz4ybxZrIUcIK_-ZdStw.text: Came here with a coworker on a quick trip to NC---  We ran the table with our order so we got to sample a lot.  The Brined Chicken was delightful and moist, drenched in sauce. My only knock is that it's a bit hard to eat since you can't use your hands to eat it, but the only reason you can't use your hands is that it is DRENCHED in delicious Alabama White Sauce! So in the scheme of things, yeah it could be easier to eat but this isn't really something to complain about.  The Chicken tender is truly spectacular. And for $2.50 per it's a steal considering how good it is. If you haven't ordered at least one you're doing it wrong. Almost tastes like the best corn dog you ever had growing up with delicious moist chicken meat. Seriously YUM.  Whatever you get, couple it with a chicken tender so you can experience it. Man, was this good.  Kale salad was a light and tasty balance to the rest of the meal.  Mac and cheese creamy but could use additional components... a bit simple for my palate but still good.  The hash browns were good but not amazing, but if you're looking for hash browns they get the job done!  Kale grits are totally unique but definitely satisfying... wasn't expecting to be wowed but I am so happy I got to try this!  To drink, the Smoked mint julep is not too sweet and definitely smoky if that's your thing... can't beat the presentation! It's not quite MY drink but it is definitely worth trying!  Truly if you get the chicken tenders and go with your gut you will land on something you're satisfied with. We sat one table over from one of the owners and it was clear she has invested considerable thought and emotion into this place and boy has it paid off. Definitely coming back and definitely recommended for anyone coming to Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cocktail menu is extensive
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked mint julep is not too sweet and definitely smoky if that&#39;s your thing... can&#39;t beat the presentation!

RjjvN0aAPGJtcOP4VaP24w.text: Place is cool,  period, so it's not a miss.  The food is "good," it's not great, but it's good. There are interesting things to try, but it just doesn't quite pop to be great. The desserts on the other hand, try the banana cream pie and the pecan waffle.  They pop, and how. If you came just for those two, you would say it's 5 stars for sure.

_Q2IxKjwpu-mWFICR-dbQw.text: Hands down favorite restaurant to go to in Charlotte. Have been here many times in group settings and the family style sides are the way to go

7xK574j80Ft1OtTNqKWGKg.text: Haberdish came highly recommended, but I found the brunch to be just good. I got the special, a rhubarb waffle with their signature honey butter. The rhubarb's consistency left much to be desired, but the actual waffle was very good. I was a bit put off by the honey butter, as they add hot sauce to it, which isn't for me. I've heard the lunch and dinner menu is very good, so I'd be willing to try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rhubarb waffle with honey butter.

6clI4L1jm_Epm6DLO62Vxg.text: This place has the best fried chicken! It is so good! Their bacon jam is also amazing. There is usually a wait so expect to wait some time, but it is so worth it!

Im8T5gRYUdd6fjAnL7_0Bg.text: I was so pleasantly surprised by this place. I loved everything about it. The food was great. They had a list of all of their vegetarian and gluten free options that made ordering really easy. It is family style, but I ordered a couple small dishes and felt like they were a nice portion. Their cocktails are beautiful and well made. I ordered an Old Fashioned that looked like a work of art. Friendly staff and great atmosphere.

B_cE9htqy8XkqJiyKiw4LA.text: Dined here for lunch.  We both ordered the chicken and waffles and shared a side of Mac and cheese with chicken skins. The chicken was good, but I ordered the tender vs the thigh. The tender was very small and kinda dry. If we didn't order the Mac and cheese which is delicious,  I would have left there hungry. The spicy honey butter syrup was quite tasty and I ended up mixing it with the other syrup. The waffle is amaZing, probably the best waffle I've ever had. The sugar balls inside provide a nice crunch with the batter that is used. The waffle is definitely a must as well as the Mac and cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

5SEo0xvFYQfjrx4qY9zS8g.text: Family style brunch? Don't mind if I do. Haberdish offers a wide variety of souther dishes all spectacularly made with great flavors that you can share with everyone. Indecisive people like me, welcome, you're gonna love it. Think of it even as tapas style brunch. Personal favorites include chicken and waffles, hushpuppies and mac and cheese

Yq5bINEEitARjyfqLz7Mtg.text: First and foremost, I am not the biggest fan of "Southern Food", even being from the south myself. Their food was very good, however, I think I had extremely high expectations after talking to friends and reading other yelp reviews that I went in from the viewpoint as if "the sides and chicken were essentially from the gods themselves".   I went here for the first time with a very large group (11 people) on a Sunday night and there was no wait, which was great! The ambiance is incredible, having both inside and outside seating (part of which is covered so you will not be basking in the sun). Our waitress was very accommodating and extremely knowledgeable and helpful. It is not too loud or quite, and you can either make it a fancy date night or a casual dinner with friends.   Thier drink menu is semi-expensive, consisting of mostly very fancy cocktails. However, I ordered a simple bloody mary and was NOT disappointed (the mix was similar to Zing-Zang).   For food, I ordered two chicken fingers (with multiple sauces) and the kale salad side. I really enjoy that they give you the option to order your chicken fingers individually (similar to what other yelpers have written). However, I wasn't head-over-heels, absolutely in love with them. To be honest, they were good (clearly better than fast-food chicken fingers), but not great, I wasn't really IN LOVE with them, like other yelpers have made it seem. The kale salad was really good as well (it came with goat cheese and oranges on top, which complemented the other flavors very nicely). I tried the tater tots as well and those were also good. I had a bite of the mac-and-cheese and it was extremely creamy and cheesy.   My biggest cons with Haberdash (and why I gave it a 3/5) would be that the menu is not that diverse in terms of light versus heavy dishes, and that the price point is just way too expensive for the amount/quality.   Like I said in the very beginning, I am not the biggest fan of 'southern food', but I do enjoy having fattening, creamy, what-your-southern-grandma-would-make food once in a while. I may have ordered different and more sides/appetizers if there were more options to complement all of the VERY heavy options. Second, the price point is annoying in itself. Everything is a la carte (which really bugs me when I have to pay extra for sides). The small kale salad was 7 dollars (see in picture) and I wish I had either gotten more or would have cost less. I think a lot of people end up getting the chicken fingers simply because they are the only thing on the menu that is appropriate for the price.  All of the other food that our table order looked and tasted delicious as well (I had a few bite of other random sides). I do not doubt that people will keep going here, I just think there are better options for your money out in downtown NODA or throughout Charlotte.   I would suggest giving this place a try if you haven't. Either you will be like the majority of reviews and absolutely love this place. Or you will be like me, where you aren't exactly disappointed, you just aren't WOW-ed by it. I am glad I went here, but I do not think I will be returning unless it is for a birthday party or group dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders with two dipping sauces (honey mustard and white bbq)
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small kale salad (goat cheese and oranges)

Y4_WDmivdO_MBZUzdrPFoA.text: Came back to haberdish for another try. Was extremely pleased this time around. Had chicken tenders and split hush puppies, sweet potato dumplings, and mac and cheese. Food was exceptional especially the sweet potato dumplings. Service was pretty poor though. Waiter wasnt very interested in visiting our table.

7JBNBzJcDWvxqNjMAsOI-g.text: Me and my coworker saw this place on yelp had good reviews so we decided to go and when we got in the place had great vibes and beautiful ambiance. The people that were working there was nice helpful and really cool. Our waitress Lynn was so great, she was helpful being it was our first time there and just sociable we will definitely be coming back when we are in the NODA area. I hope Lynn will be serving us.

6Q-O5MJF2GDsKkzvvfRLFg.text: The food was the bomb!!! I wasn't expecting it to be that great. I pass it by quite often but never stopped in until tonight. I was just so thankful for every bite I took of their food.   The menu is simple and straight to the point. I went with a friend and we ordered tenders and a side of Mac N Cheese with the chicken skins and hot sauce along with the cornbread pudding. We were able to split our sides and still get full. I have never had a cornbread pudding that was so delicious in all my life.   The customer service was great and I will definitely return soon!

XDxSuqmHfFaS1zwnPfMU2w.text: Y'all.   I don't even say y'all and this place will make you want to say it.   The vibe is classy southern dishes in a trendy cocktail lounge. I love it. It's located right in the heart of NoDa which is perfect for walking to anything else before or after. They have a big patio space, and the inside is light an airy. Very inviting.   The drink menu is extensive and intricate with beer, wine and signature cocktails. The drinks are fantastic--the bloody mary is amazing (I know how silly that sounds, but trust me)!  THE FOOD. I don't even know where to start. The hush puppies with honey butter are a must. Please order these. The dill house pickles...if you're a fan of pickles, they do a daily preparation as well as the dill and bread and butter, they are fantastic. The mac n' cheese and fried chickens are delicious. You can order the sides in small or large orders--the large is LARGE, it's great if you want to order a few and serve it up family style.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hush puppies with sweet tea butter
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

HSY9QaiMPZtoaesVHjSDPQ.text: TLDR: a charming little Southern-style restaurant. They have a small, but inclusive menu (including vegetarian options), but the highlight of this sweet place is their...CHICKEN! Try the 1/2 roasted chicken (~$13) with their finger-licking Alabama white BBQ sauce with delicious sides. Three words: mac 'n cheese.   My friend tried their chicken tenders with a side waffle and loved it! Two tenders and a waffle filled her up plenty. Everything on the menu is meant to be ordered a la carte.   Just a heads up, this place gets SUPER busy and doesn't take recommendations. They'll take your number so you can walk around the seat while you wait for yours, and they get through pretty quickly!

-zo_9Kaa5mQqq8tcYRmVaQ.text: I had one experience at this restaurant since i heard about it when it opened. So  they had Tiki theme,so the restaurant and the drink menu was decked out with the theme, this was dope.  The drinks were AMAZING. The drink I had was not just delicious but also strong enough to give me a desirable buzz.  The fried chicken ( dark meat )was amazing and I love the crust that the cook made, and that crunch took my breath away. The sides , Mac and cheese and collard greens where actually mediocre. I give it a pass because I'm used to home cooked version of both and shall not hold it to the same standard.   Pros  - Polite staff  - Amazing drinks  - Super diverse and inclusive crowd - Quick food and drink turn over times  - Lovely atmosphere   Cons - A long wait at times  - Tricky NODA parking  - Meh sides   Pro Tip - Use the yelp app to get a place in line early, before you come.  - If your dining for two, order the full bird instead of two half's , save a little money

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hurricane  Pineapple Rum Punch

0kS-1Cb3qQYyO9-N0aF0Kw.text: My fiance and I stopped by on Sunday around lunch time and the place was slightly busy, but there was no wait for a table. We were seat promptly and quickly placed our orders. I ordered the dark meat chicken and the Mac n cheese while my fiance also got the Mac n cheese with the skins on top.   The chicken was great, but the Mac n cheese was a disappointment. Mine at least was slightly cold on the inside and had a powdery texture to the sauce. But besides that it just wasn't good. My fiance also made the same comments about his order.

XPg0NcoCnkZDgc7WbrngaQ.text: A cool experience overall, some very delicious items with a unique take on elevated southern cuisine. Loved the fried chicken tenders, bacon jam biscuit, and glazed carrots. Crunchy and juicy chicken with delicious Alabama white sauce, fluffy biscuit with flavorful jam, and tangy sweet carrots!   The waffle, sweet potato dumplings, and bloody mary were disappointing. Waffle was small for $4 and not fluffy like the biscuit. Sweet potato dumplings were shockingly bland, and bloody Mary was not strong at all, get a beer.   Service was good, location is great, and atmosphere is very cool. Price point was a lot more than I expected to spend, can't afford to come too often.

Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carrots, amazing!!!

UsMuY0tdY2hB1dCZewqOxA.text: Went for the weekday only brunch. Not busy at 10am on a Thursday. Service was friendly and relaxed. Tried the quiche du jour, Smoked Mackerel, Bacon, & Goat Cheese. Very light and airy, with a perfectly crisp crust. The Tater Tot Benedict was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super cool vintage atmosphere

6JAPopYDbI5UIfcDXnDp6A.text: I came here to eat and it was great. It would have been a fun place to have a drink at, too!   The mac and cheese is really good. About the only thing I didn't like at the restaurant was the chicken skin topping for the mac and cheese.  We arrived here starved and got a whole smoked chicken, fried chicken fingers, a salad, a pickle and more.   I like the house made ranch - that is really good.   They dump a sauce all over the smoked chicken - which was really great and had us mopping up the plate - but if you are a picky eater you may want to ask for the sauce on the side!

ygjb9kE6QhLQfNrkt4qmAA.text: My overall experience here was lovely. I sat at the bar, and the bartender was very friendly. The cocktail list was extensive and had a lot of variety. Both cocktails I had were delicious. I ordered a couple chicken fingers and the deviled eggs to snack on. The chicken fingers were hot and crispy, and the dipping sauces were very tasty. They sell the chicken fingers as singles which I liked, I ordered 2 and they were very big, I couldn't finish them. I also ordered the deviled eggs, and I topped them with the local trout as was recommended by my bartender. I lovvveeeee deviled eggs, but unfortunately these just didn't do it for me. I want to blame it on the trout but I think that overall the deviled eggs just didn't have much flavor. I would definitely go back for cocktails and chicken when in town- Haberdish was the most frequently recommended restaurant when I was in Charlotte so I'm interested in the other food on the menu as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled eggs with local trout
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fingers

o-RcsKOmcfyMbbM7ak7aow.text: First of all the atmosphere is so cute. The building and interiors is amazing and the history behind it makes it that much better. We started off with a friend green tomato special which needs to be a permanent menu item it was so good.  We had hush puppies and the deviled eggs as starters and both were great.  We order the fried chicken, tater tots, sweet potato dumplings, purple cabbage and collards. Loved the cabbage, the tots and dumplings weren't the best I've ever had but still tasty.   This place has amazing cocktails and the banana pudding was so good!  Overall good spot would totally recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomato and besame drink
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hush puppies and eggs

rYVAxInbLfcGbLBaUBa3-w.text: Came here with friends as a group of seven including a little one. It was a busy Sunday afternoon but we were seated pretty quickly none the less. Me and the hubby just got drinks and shared an app. I got the pink grapefruit phosphate and the hubby got the wrong place right time. Both were really tasty. We shared the biscuits and bacon jam and woah was it filling. The biscuit tho was a tad dry/hard. We also snuck a hashpuppy off a friends plate and it was really good. Better then any hush puppy Iv had in the past. In fact I used to say I didn't like them but after this one I guess I can't say that anymore!  Def looking forward to coming back and trying some of that fried chicken everyone talks about and sampling a few more drinks off the cocktail menu!!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits and bacon jam
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wrong place right time

J7aj13DQ--KPzC27he4tWg.text: Fabulous brunch? Check. Wonderful dinner? Check. Amazing cocktails? Check. Awesome atmosphere? Check. If your heart desires great food and drinks, Haberdish will not let you down. The sweet potato dumplings, mac and cheese, and hush puppies are a few of my favorite things - but you really can't go wrong here. And as an added bonus, their food and drinks are totes insta worthy for all of the foodies out there - and one of the few places where it tastes as good as it looks!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles, mac and cheese, pickles, and a Bloody Mary. No better way to brunch!

n9mOHNhgjcsJaIjL5n3pLQ.text: Had the perfect date night here at Haberdish.  The hubby and I found ourselves kid-free and took the recommendation of family to come here.  We were pleasantly surprised how much we loved our meal.  We started with the deviled eggs w/smoked trout...sounds a bit odd but really the best deviled egg I've ever eaten.  Moving on we tried the daily special Arranchinni.  Wow!  This was my favorite bite of the evening.  Our meal finished out with some of the best fried chicken, red cabbage and Mac n Cheese.  Our least favorite was the Mac n Cheese, but that's not to say it wasn't tastey.  Super friendly staff and great suggestions from our server.  Loved the vibe and ambiance here.  A little on the loud side, but still enjoyable.   Oh I'd be amiss if I didn't mention the awesome glassware and plates we were served on.  Definitely lived our meal, which was served family style, by the way.  For the quality and taste, the total check was very reasonable too!  Give them a try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Arranchinni...yum!!
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Cabbage
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac n Cheese w/ crispy chicken skins

HxyuM9aRx3VaUa_DqirPug.text: First time in Charlotte and some of my friends got us on the waitlist for the restaurant through Yelp!   Let me just start with the atmosphere which was awesome! Chic and very fitting for the upscale soul food vibe. The place was hopping on a Saturday night and the noise level is a bit loud but definitely tolerable.  Food is designed to be family style which we really didn't abide by. I don't like sharing ha. I had the 1/2 chicken and Mac and cheese. It was immediately noticeable that the pasta in the Mac and cheese is freshly made. It was perfect! My chicken was delicious until I got to my chicken breast which had some raw batter inside. I kindly let the staff know and they fixed it and were very courteous.  Overall a decent place for upscale soul food and a good place for large groups. Make sure you check in on the waitlist before you head down there!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

THcp47iUZUxpI9pWm4_pGQ.text: Updating my experiences is not always fun but in this case, I am so pleased I made the last visit because it was a good one. They have since updated the cocktail menu since my last visit and it is fantastic. Two of the drinks I had that stood out and highly recommend are Apothecary, which is a very special add, not only because it has CBD as add but the cocktail is DELICIOUS. The second cocktail was so pretty I almost didn't even want to drink it. The fried chicken is always tasty and the mac'n'cheese is awesome. I was not a fan of the fried okra, it literally was mush. The carrots were delicious and would definitely order it again.   I have said it once and I will say it again, the bar tenders are not friendly, at all..that really needs to change. All and all, I will keep going and always recommend to those wanting to explore NoDa.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Apothecary Cocktail with CBD on the side

tggXf-FVdfKB1EsQ74j4Bw.text: Haberdish isn't one of my go-to spots and it is what it is. Not sure why my taste buds won't allow them to be my favorite spot, but nevertheless, if you enjoy or you think you enjoy Southern style food, then this place is the way to go!  I came here this past Sunday for an early lunch with my BF. I ordered their Mac and Cheese, Sweet Potato Dumplings, and my bf ordered fried chicken. I wanted to order their tater tots, but they ran out?! (at 11:30 AM?!) So, I made a random and quick decision and ordered the deviled eggs - I don't like deviled eggs, I don't know why I did this. Anyways, both the sweet potato dumplings & mac/cheese were great. My bf enjoyed his fried chicken as well. I did not like the deviled eggs at all, as expected. While I won't be back, I would definitely recommend to others because the place was packed within an hour of us being seated!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

9cK8e2jRTZojAWqNFRzGTA.text: This great experience began by using Yelp's newer waitlist function. The restaurant had almost a 90 minute wait and I was able to waitlist at home then show up just in time to order cocktails at the bar and be seated shortly after.   This southern style inspired restaurant did an excellent job on the food. From the fried chicken, mac n' cheese, pickles, hush puppies, and more, nothing was amiss.  The beverage menu is extensive with beers, wines, and cocktails. I particularly liked how the cocktails are laid out by style. The bar tenders were friendly and attentive.   The atmosphere is original and warm. I felt very comfortable.   So, why the missing star? Clearly the wait staff is overworked here. Our waitress had way too many tables to truly offer the service she was capable of (as determined by the great interactions we had with her). The biggest miss was when I couldn't get anyone's attention, got up myself to the bussing station and got plates for my group before our served food got cold. Rather than be embarrassed, she seemed a little annoyed I had done this, but who wants room temperature fried chicken!?  I'd definitely go back, hands down.

GZ-j8PNvgYMvPZJCyJip0g.text: So I get the hype but not sure it merits a 5-star rating. Our assessment:  SERVICE - fantastic, quirky, friendly. We asked our waitress to sit down with us. DRINKS - incredible, my husband and I both got a cocktail and loved them. There is a spin on a manhattan that I loved. FOOD - so this is the rub. So its good, for sure. But not amazing. I've had better southern dishes, esp. mac n cheese, fried chicken, etc. But again, nothing was bad but just not memorable.  Price point also felt a bit high for what it was but I know the decor and drinks were more upscale. The food just wasnt. Get there early and get your name on the list. Then go have a drink around the block and your table will be ready faster than they tell you :)

fcbTLLvSTHop_BHtJDBCpg.text: I have never been treated with so much disrespect in an establishment. We ordered the hash browns, livermush toast, two 1/2 chickens, sweet potato dumplings, Mac and cheese with chicken skin, and the banana pudding.  First off, we did not receive the livermush toast, one 1/2 chicken, nor the banana pudding because the waitress "forgot to put in our order".   Secondly, my husband tried to order a grey goose with tonic and our waitress "didn't know if the bar had grey goose" and kept insisting that we order something off the cocktail menu instead (clearly because she was too lazy to go check). Honestly, what  waitress doesn't know if they have grey goose vodka or not?! You shouldn't be a waitress if you don't know what's behind the bar.   This was the kicker, forty five minutes into our dinner, I didn't have one drink at the establishment yet. I asked if I could place a drink order. She said, "Some of you are "slurring" your words and I don't feel comfortable serving you." Excuse me?! I'm Asian, enough said. This is what set me off.   Oh and top of that, she muttered, "Maybe after you all have filled your bellies I'll consider serving you a drink." Insinuating we were wasted. Wow. Just wow. I'm sorry, but our table of four ordered a total of two drinks the entire time we were there, were more sober than 99% of the restaurant, and was just having a good time with each other cutting up. It was embarrassing and no one should ever be treated like that.   Worst experience at an establishment ever. I am definitely not the one to want a free meal, but when we complained to the manager he made zero effort to make things right. I have never been more offended in my life. Bad service, bad management and bad sweet potato dumplings (which I don't think was actually sweet potato dumplings). Who knows what our waitress brought us.

mnTZL60o2QrODvkaEqLhvA.text: Brought wife, kids and visiting family from OH.  The boiled peanuts were a hit with northern visitors.  2 bowls later the kids food appeared like clockwork. Drinks were good start while we play word search and tic toe with kids mon menu.  Sat on patio on a hot day and it didn't feel to bad.  A misting system would make the patio better in the scorching temps. Kids food came well in advance of the adults food which is a good thing but it's hard to resist tasting their chicken fingers and it was out of this world good!! They brought my daughter and son lemon for their chicken and when my daughter wanted Mac N cheese as a side they accommodated no problem. Ok. But too long between adult meals and kids.  More than 15 minutes and counting......patience is a virtue. Ok. Quality of food redeem this place!! Everyone is loving their food from the fried chicken to the smoke chicken with the white sauce and the ribs. Sweet potato dumplings were also very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huge portion and a half chicken and tater tot&#39;s for a side.

0Tx_NC7a6W1RL6dB2SSVaw.text: My husband and I have eaten at Haberdish a few times now, and really like their food.  But just be prepared for a wait, even if you visit during a non-busy time.  Their deviled eggs are delicious - very creamy, and filled to overflowing.  We've tried their fried chicken, fried cauliflower, and cast iron trout as our entrees.  Their chicken is very crispy and tender inside.  And the chicken pieces are quite large, too.  At $9.50 for a two piece white meal (without sides, as those are extra), I feel it's a great value.  Their cauliflower is an interesting concept.  I think it's a great option for a vegetarian, but I'm not sure we'd get it again, as their other options are just too good to pass up.  The cast iron trout is more than double the price of the chicken, but it was melt-in-your mouth delicious.  That could have been from the loads of butter they cooked it in, but it tasted fantastic and was not too salty, as some others have pointed out.  I didn't eat the skin, however.  Their sides are also good.  We've had their purple cabbage and collards, and both were decently shareable portions.    It does take some time to get drinks from the bar, as well as your food.  So just sit back, relax, and wait for a treat.  We'll definitely be back!

CJqe05zKBGRjQWXmEwjOWg.text: I was spending the weekend in Charlotte and while doing my "foodie research" decided I needed to go to Charlotte's best restaurant of 2017, which is Haberdish. I know, I know we are in 2019 but still they must be doing something right... =]   A cool bar  located in newly gentrified Noda district this restaurant caters to young, trendy and chic crowds by offering amazing cocktails, many wines and beers. Once you walk inside you can't miss the metal chairs, and bare wood tables with just enough edge to make the space feel trendy without becoming pretencious. The name "Haberdish" was also inspired by the word "haberdashery," in keeping with Charlotte's textile mill history.  Fried chicken and Mac and cheese with crispy chicken crumbs aren't just a must order--you can't leave Charlotte without a taste.   Enough said, lets move on to the good part...the food!  Let's be honest you come here for the chicken, Brined, battered, and fried, the chicken at Haberdish can be ordered half, whole, or in two-piece white or dark meat options. They also offer chicken tenders if you're not ready to commit to something bigger. Crisp and brown on the outside their chicken is just made to perfection.  From house pickles to smoked deviled eggs and sweet potato dumplings, the appetizers make for the perfect bite every time. I also highly recommend the mac & cheese, fried chicken and the smoked chicken (delicious white sauce)  From a well-thought-out theme that carries over from the food and cocktails to the decor, Haberdish is absolutely a must go in Charlotte

zretDc2EpoJIFbYml_7lhg.text: Oh man I loved this place! I had to avoid it after a while because every time I visited I'd eat my weight in delicious Southern food. The chicken is good, but it's all the other stuff that makes this place awesome - the sides, the appetizers (I was obsessed with the seasonal pickles), the drinks, and the desserts. Service was typically really great, and I found the prices to be excellent value considering the quality of the food, drinks, service, and surroundings. Last time I visited the woman working behind the bar found out I was in town for work and went out of her way to give me a bunch of great recommendations for local food and entertainment.

9Vym9g9nlIiVvgqs3YO-BA.text: This restaurant seems to appropriately fit in NoDa. The inside makes me think of California or the Northwest. Great vibe and friendly staff make the experience that much better. We started with the drinks Honeybee and the Mint Julep which were both really good. The Honeybee is a bit pricey and doesn't actually come with a piece of the flower that gives it the special tingle but it was still a good one-time experience.   We ordered an app of hush puppies, a whole fried chicken, sides of mac and cheese, and savory corn bread pudding. Everything was excellent. The fried chicken was some of the best in town. If I was to critique any of the food I could only say the mac and cheese was really good but nothing fantastic and the corn bread pudding was great but I would have preferred it to be a little more juicy or have a drizzle of some melted cheese or sauce. Grilling the corn bread pudding on the flat top dries it out and with no sauce it looses its "bread pudding" title.   Regardless of the little details, I loved the trip and I will definitely be back.

BwlmkygqFW2IM4q3taM-7Q.text: We went to dinner with some friends and their new born at Haberdish, on Saturday and we were pleasantly surprised. The place has a nice atmosphere with a nice decor, and good mood music. The menu was a little small not much a selection, we ordered the ribs and it was a little disappointing it was dry, but everything else was good.

38cKBsoyDr9LRUGOtClvig.text: Best fried chicken in Charlotte. The sweet potato dumplings and the biscuits are also must orders. The staff is always knowledgeable about the menu and the cocktails. Don't be afraid to ask for a recommendation.

rPgzkIC9W7bZq-g_dc1Ihw.text: Food seemed salty. We had four small plate they were all over salted. Drinks over priced but taste good but with all the options in clt prob won't go back.

bAUq3aWKTo517Bq6w_N74g.text: Came here after hiking in Smoky mountain. Sooooo goood! The okra, broccoli steak, fried chicken are the highlights. The atmosphere is great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

waI-vOCDM3VBhO4twqCGcQ.text: For my birthday weekend, we went to Brunch at the Haberdish in Noda. It is a cute little restaurant, that giver off a modern farm/rustic feel. They don't take reservations so get there at a decent time because the line can get long. Everything from Haberdish is locally grown, even their chicken! For brunch (at the time) they offer a limited menu. The most breakfasty item they had was chicken and waffles. Probably the best I have ever had. The waffles have little pearl sugar in them which create a sweater waffle. Their honey butter syrup is to die for too, honestly goes so well over the chicken. Their sides are family style and I 10/10 recommend the mac & cheese. I had also tried their Blonde Bloody Mary, which is cathead vodka, yellow tomato Bloody Mary mix, lime, and olives. I personally wasn't a huge fan of this because I am really into spicy Bloody Mary's and this was on the sweeter side with an odd after taste. Next time I would like to go for dinner and I hear that they have a bigger variety of a brunch menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

l7RA9DpKSQ1d6ERwx1Fx2A.text: Went there for dinner to celebrate my mom's birthday. We've heard such great things about Haberdish so we were very excited. Overall we thought it was ok, but probably wouldn't go back. Hate to be negative, but it just wasn't anything special. Our server was great and the ambiance is awesome but we weren't crazy about the food. We had two cocktails that were pretty good but I would try something different if I find myself there again. We had the fried chicken, okra, Mac and cheese and hushpuppies. The chicken and okra were good but the rest was just ok. Definitely not bad, but definitely wasn't as good as I thought it would be.

WjZ1R3VeJsqyPJIIm7k2dw.text: Wow, it's tough for me to give 5-stars, but I almost want to for Haberdish -- great atmosphere, great food, good drinks, very good service. We left wanting to go back, and that's actually a nice thing these days. (When we do, if our experience is as good the 2nd time, I'll likely change this to a 5-star review.) Was definitely a nice evening, and glad we went!

9Q8hlxGj9EFxqut-20xDuQ.text: Very cool atmosphere. Drinks are fun. Food was great. Fried chicken was perfect. Mac n Cheese with chicken skins is as good as it sounds.

nt8BlqX_t-ZQn8uu8WnFXQ.text: I AM SO SERIOUS THEY HAVE THE BEST CHICKEN IN ALL OF CHARLOTTE! I really had to use all caps just to convey how impressed we were with the chicken. I mean it was absolutely incredible!! Cocktails and draft beers were amazing as well. It's definitely an amazing place to do an a la carte brunch for you and a few friends. Love the vibe, obviously obsessed with the food, and the establishment as a whole.

1bmZltNBi5vXzdFmH90JIQ.text: By far my favorite restaurant in CHARLOTTE! The food, drinks, and atmosphere are out of this world. You have to visit and try the hush puppies....to die for . I also love their chicken tenders because they are HUGE and come with some delicious side sauces. You will not be disappointed!

ajn0z07rFJXsxAf-0NJP-w.text: Every single dish we ordered was finger licking delicious, decadent and unique.  The fried chicken was perfect.   Soft pieces of chicken covered with crispy perfectly seasoned skin.  Our three sides were the sweet potato dumplings, charred okra and kale grits!   AMAZING!!!!! And while the banana pudding was perfect, it was the waffle sundae that took the prize!   An incredible night with food beyond my standards.  A must!!!!

fpdUmUQaa3knrQcYy0V_SA.text: It was a good atmosphere, I got the specialty chicken. Nothing bad to say at all about this place

xPOQm3cXqI0LwjBXtj9ijA.text: So good! Food is so good...sweet tea butter is mouth watering! Chicken so crispy...Mac and cheese so creamy...okra so okra-ey! Cocktails made me tipsy

dMdsCVLWkZAEMRdR45IwLw.text: Super service. Great inventive menu. Wonderful wine list can't recommend this place highly enough.

PMDvlPNvHq1Aw_84azLx6w.text: If you are not on a diet and love Southern food, then this place is PERFECT! We had hush puppies as an appetizer which were delicious. I had the traditional bone in chicken with sides of mac n cheese and cornbread pudding. The chicken and mac n cheese were good, but not as unique as I was hoping for. Cornbread pudding was so good and had melted gruyere cheese in some bites. I'll be needing some extra time at the gym for this meal, but SO WORTH!

acGcPZhm_5m4Qlnnmf_AAg.text: Great atmosphere at this tasty spot! We ate on the patio, and it was a wonderful environment for a delicious meal. It started sprinkling a bit, but no sweat, they closed the mechanical slats above us, turning the open patio into a covered one - very cool. The chicken was deliciously seasoned and tender. The mac and cheese with fried chicken skins is a must! Great drinks, although a bit pricey, but paired with the reasonably priced food, it all evened out. Awesome spot in the heart of downtown NoDa!

J7GaE5BGGuFu7AxiAaZlKQ.text: After reading about Haberdish (seemingly everywhere lately), we decided to go tonight.  The general vibe and decor are spot-on.  Contemporary industrial(ish) without feeling contrived or "me too".  Our server was quick to greet us and always tended to our table - she was sweet and helpful but not overly sugary.  We got there about 545P (on a Tues) and were seated right away.  There were only a handful of tables occupied then, but within about 30mins, the place was packed.   We got hushpuppies for an app and the chicken-fried cauliflower steaks for dinner with sides of savory bread pudding and mac & cheese as sides to share.  We got a double order of m&c and it was a huuuge plate's worth!  Could've easily done the single order and would have been plenty, but we had lots of leftovers to take home.  Everything we had was phenomenal and had a hard time picking a favorite dish.  We were so impressed with the meal that we ordered the chocolate sheet cake (not a whole one...) for dessert and it did not disappoint.  Prices are more than reasonable, especially considering the high quality of the food and great service, and the portions are extremely generous.  We arrived very hungry and left stuffed (with more than half our meals in to-go bags too!).  Needless to say, we loved it and will definitely be back.  What a great addition to Noda and the Charlotte culinary scene.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

xqt7RRkmm_aX_F9tLdURaQ.text: Haberdish is one of my favorite restaurants! I love all of their sides! The okra and kale salad are my top 2!

Jl9xU2ZF-AedWTdh_PNwSw.text: I really enjoyed the vibe and decor of Haberdish. I would say that their menu does lack a little variety as far as entrees go. I split a few dishes with a friend of mine and we didn't try the fried chicken (probably should have based on the fact that that's what everyone said is the best). We had the pickles, one of their salads (which was pretty large as a starter). We opted for the "healthier" chicken option which was roasted and it was delicious! I thoroughly enjoyed everything that we ate.  Their service was a little wonky, and that could be because they are still fairly new. If you order a cocktail, the bartender will bring it to your table. You have a server, but you may see a few faces as your plates come out. There was some confusion surrounding the wine that we ordered. It finally got squared away by the time our entree was already out.  Despite the slightly unorganized serving style, we really enjoyed are time here. I'll definitely be back!

_0Bk5CufKsu_dZzhTiESLg.text: My wife and I met another couple here for dinner because of a recommendation from a friend.  I'm so glad that we decided to go. The food was amazing!  The chicken tenders are huge and the dipping sauces are homemade.  We couldn't make up our minds on side dishes, so we ordered 6 of them to share at the table.  I can't say which one was the best because they each were soooo good.  If I had to pick, it would probably be the tater tots.

o_DFH6DN_Dp9malSMSXSfQ.text: Awesome. Had the 2 piece dark chicken, okra, Mac and cheese (with skins) and pickles to start.  All excellent.  Also had an old fashioned and they know what they are doing. This is a no BS place- do the chicken right +Make a solid old fashioned + Delicious Mac and cheese = winner. I will go back for sure and this will be the first restaurant I recommend to anyone visiting Charlotte. Cheers.

SjlNMFODNANKtTSywoQs2Q.text: OMG, this family sharing Resturant is always popping in the Noda area ... screened in porch with the best southern feel coupled with friend Chicken, Mac and cheese, hush puppies and pickles!!! My friends and I truly enjoy everything about this place

fIUdMgpQxNHwhsQNnCAOTw.text: I didn't have high expectations for this place. I looked at their menu beforehand and wasn't interested. But boy was I wrong! My boyfriend really wanted to check this place out. He loves chicken and waffle, and we heard this place was famous for it, so we gave it a try. Because they had a small menu, I just ended up getting a kale salad, and it was so delicious! (I rarely say that kale about salads!) They didn't have "chicken and waffles" on the menu, but our server was kind enough to get that order for my boyfriend. His dark meat chicken was very tender and juicy. The waffle was so good that he had to order another one. We also ordered hush puppies (not pictured because we devoured it so quickly) and it was probably the best hush puppies I've ever had. In addition to the good food, service was really good and our server was always attentive. We will definitely be returning.   On a side note, my only complaint is that their menu isn't extensive enough. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

JH5Km7pBZAmlkFsc_nz8Cw.text: The best southern food restaurant that I've ever been to by far! I really enjoyed the deviled eggs especially!

NqALdWk-U-PAcKoYRT7MgA.text: Haberdish has reinvented what a hushpuppy and a tatertot should taste like - their version is out of this world amazing!!   The menu is very limited. More small bites, chicken, chicken, trout, pork shank and more chicken. There is one vegetarian option (cauliflower steak).   I have not tried a drink yet but their list is very extensive and lots of variety.  The staff has a long way to go in being comfortable with the menu - they were very hesitant and couldn't make the best recommendations - understandable considering they opened a little over a month ago.   Cant wait to go back!

e8I4uBV179Ahn1sMVpjolw.text: V confused about the reviews, Haberdish was overpriced and average at best. They also have some of the steepest cocktail prices I've ever seen in Charlotte: $11-$15 what? The fried chicken and biscuit were decent but all of our sides were awful. One reviewed below hit it spot on.. someone has a super heavy hand with garlic salt on the mac and cheese, that's literally all you can taste. Kale salad is tiny for $7, okra was oily and bland. Service is also pretty apathetic, no water refills, dishes left on the table even after we paid the check.

yYOb5mGzceXTsWGprLgOtA.text: Love. This. Place. Go for the weekday brunch!! They serve the best cinnamon roll that you will eve taste. Love the atmosphere. The chicken tenders are some of the best ever. Cocktails are on point. They make a great old fashioned. Again, I like to go for brunch. Cinnamon roll and coffee to start. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. One of my favorite Charlotte spots!

1qlbmiE6rY_NqIhis5cYFw.text: I was there for breakfast and got the egg tartine and it was disgusting. It's supposed to come with a poached egg and mine was not cooked at all! The dish was completely flavorless. Maybe it's better for dinner. We'll see.

OsgX_ZoYdRraBRmBC1Bthw.text: This place is a gem. The chicken is great and the sides are amazing. Definitely a hot, brunch spot on the weekends.

WL9snN5qf8lvDfvcTLQtYg.text: Really eclectic drink menu. Food was delicious. Vibe was very chill. Bartenders were great!

S8y1l6EJs3cpL7faWJ7biw.text: Fry chicken banging, okra amazing however the waitress forgot to put both mine and my husband's order in.  The only reason we did not leave is because we were super hungry. New folks sat next to us got there food and left and we still didn't get ours.

4eVdkqGP5slOW-xhbVeJRQ.text: Have always enjoyed a meal here. Love the fried chicken and Mac and cheese!! Always a casual chill atmosphere for a date night.

7Ug_82Zr4jFwUrk6YrYcSw.text: After hanging out in the area, I had to find dinner and still had southern food on my bread with the holiday season coming about.  I decided to try a bookmarked restaurant and made an online order as I found close parking.  The order took about 15-20 mins.  The restaurant was warm and cozy.  The room was dim with romantic lighting perfect for a date.  Seating and bar was spaced appropriately.  I got some of the most favorite picks: Alabama brin chicken, Mac n cheese, and sweet potato dumpling (curious based on the name & topping). The takeout separated well and compacted neatly.  Everything was good and like another reviewer I oddly felt the dumplings could have came with a syrup in the side.  Seems a sweet topping could have fit in.  The chicken has be fired in bacon fat judging from the smell and taste.  It was good and fulfilling (non greasiness).  Mac and cheese was superb.  I was waited on upon visiting the bar and wish well on the way out by two different employees.  Always a good thing.  One bartender was snarky when I sat at the bar for my finished order.  I told her I had been helped by her colleague behind her but we'll look over her.  Glad to recommend and return.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Alabama chicken w/ Mac, sweet potato dumpling to go

88BkbbFCL92qVQ3dv3NPuw.text: Great service, great food. Highly recommend the smoked chicken. Cocktails were awesome, sat on the enclosed outdoor patio and loved it!

vdHxggE5AaViHObql1f3Pw.text: Went here for the first time today with my partner. Service was excellent and quick. I had the fried chicken as well as the Mac and cheese with fried chicken skins on top. The chicken was fresh and came out quickly and the skin was crispy just how I like it. They had their own twist on a liver mush over toast that my partner tried and surprisingly was pretty good. The deviled eggs were only five bucks, a little on the salty side but never the less worth it. Overall would definitely come back and try the other entrees although the food menu was limited they still had a pretty good selection. Big win for their drink menu. I had a champagne punch that was refreshing and surprisingly not too sweet, definitely would come back for drinks, great spot to grab drinks, meet up with friends, group settings with outside seating and indoor.

GUh81Hat_XLrpcFqNqWcXA.text: Ok. So, l've been here twice. The first time, l sat at the bar and  l had the deviled eggs and the half smoked chicken with white sauce. I also ordered  a few cocktails. Anything from the punch and refreshers column should serve you well.  SO the smoked chicken was dry and nothing of it tasted "smoked". More like "baked" and it was a huge plate of chicken, l must say. As l looked around, l noticed most people just had piles of chicken tenders on their plate. I see l made a mistake. The deviled eggs were delicious. I added smoked trout. Yum. The mac and cheese is a good concept, but it really has no flavor. You have to add the chicken skins with hot sauce and then it gets a little better. The second time l went- eggs not so good. I tried the tenders- over priced an overrated. Twice is enough for me at this place, but l would definitely suggest giving it a try. It is eclectic and different. It is small and they seat you pretty close to other people.

8Kvmj1pGrgUNB9wrZ1XQhA.text: Ultimate southern comfort food experience. Has fun country farmhouse charm inside. Mac cheese with chicken skins on top is a MUST!  We got 2 tenders as our main dish and shared a bunch of large sides at our table of 4. This ended up being a really affordable dinner!  Okra and sweet potato curds wasn't impressive. Hush puppies and hard boiled eggs were amazing.

gAEbRnqrjnvXzHP3maHlkg.text: Service was slow and the waitress was bothered that we had questions since it was our first time, I will give her the benefit of the doubt and assume she was just having a bad day. Both the food and coffee made up for it! Very small menu but we came for the famous fried chicken and did not leave hungry!

VKDv955CcFH5pOM-Lb5fNA.text: Rounded out a weekend of good friends and good food with a stop at Haberdish. A very cool location in NoDa, and they do a great job of decorating along their southern theme.   Dinner consisted of hush puppies (appetizer), two pieces of friend chicken with fried okra and kale grits on the side, and the lemon tart (dessert). The hush puppies were delicious, but I think it's probably hard to screw that up. My favorite part was the fried chicken. Two good sized pieces (a breast and a wing) that were so SO good. Not too much breading, thick, and juicy - full of flavor. The fried okra was also a show-stopper. I wasn't a huge fan of the kale grits, but I have a bias against kale for no good reason! I'm not usually a big dessert person, but the lemon tart was great.  The service was not inattentive, but was slower than I would have liked, hence the four stars. We ended up spending close to two hours! Overall a great experience though.

CO_QRPrV_5UBWcxQk5Yfpw.text: Haberdish has been on my list to try, and I am so glad I finally made it! First off, the decor and atmosphere are really cool. I would describe it as southern chic; I also love the outdoor patio area.  We ordered hushpuppies to start, and they were so good. They were really crispy on the outside and really soft on the inside. They're made with a different dough than typical hush puppies, and they were delicious. The tea butter was unique and added great flavor.  For dinner, I ordered 2 chicken fingers (you can order them a la carte!) and my fiance and I shared two sides -- the okra and kale grits. My chicken tenders were excellent -- juicy and crispy at the same time. The kale grits were fabulous and made me feel like I was eating something healthy. The grits has great consistency - not rubbery but not soupy.   For dessert, we tried the lemon tart and the buttermilk icecream. Both were excellent -- great flavor! The buttermilk ice cream was definitely unique, but I liked it.  I will definitely be back!

igire_uA4JzwF5uedExeqg.text: Edit: The management here reached out to me personally.  That alone wins them back a star. Still havent been back, but thought I should make note of it.   End of edit.  I expected a lot more given the hype around this place. The food was good (just good) which is the only reason I gave this place 2 stars. The other 3 stars are missing due completely to front of house issues I experienced during my visit. I served throughout college and am pretty patient, but frankly the service flat out sucked. Like really sucked.   We started by grabbing a drink from the bar while waiting for our friends. The girl that helped us was a snarky and condescending. It was pretty obvious she didnt really want to be there.  If you go to their bar, try and get the male bartender with the long hair as he's much nicer and friendlier.  At the table, our waitress was just a mess.  It was Sunday night and the restaurant was well staffed, and yet our waitress was seemingly too busy to stand by our table for more than 5 seconds. As a consequence we never got her name. After our appetizer we sat at the table for 15+ minutes before she came back to take our order, and she had to come back by and ask us again what it was because she'd forgotten parts of it. (Maybe she should have written it down?)  As the food came out, she was nowhere in sight. The foodrunners (or other servers?) ran our food out and we were  missing an item.  We just figured she didnt put it in and were going to let it go, but she came back to the table after we'd asked for our bills and noticed we hadnt gotten some of our food. Aka this item died in the window. She would probably have known if she ran any of the food or came by at all.   Foodwise...  Biscuits with bacon jam were very meh.  Never thought I'd say this, but it was too much bacon and not enough biscuit.   Fried chicken was okay. Pretty juicy but heavily breaded and a bit saltier than I prefer. Decently spiced. All-around, just alright.   Sides were the best part of the meal. Cornbread pudding, okra, and cheesy grits were all very flavorful and textually pleasant. The okra was not over or undercooked, and had some firmness to it. The cornbread pudding was very nice- rich, decadent, and a bit sweet.   Despite haberdish's played out concept, the restaurant manages to have some level of uniqueness and identity. One that I actually liked.  The food was alright and the ambiance was nice, but the service was terrible. Overall, I'd go once more to try it again if the service hadn't been such garbage. But it was. So I probably won't be back.

-vyAZftSX9YT-Vc6EE0EIQ.text: Went for lunch around 1:00 PM. When reviewing the menu, we saw they had limited lunch options. Finally finding something we would order, the waitress informed us that they were out of several items. We ordered, only to be told about 5 mins later that they only served one of our selected dishes at dinner. We left to find a restaurant that had a decent selection and was able to serve what was on the menu. If you want something other than quiche or chicken strips (assuming they still have any left to serve), you will need to find another place.

zA8FpFjZkTZNPjLIdbQYBg.text: Excellent food. The chicken was great. The waiter provided great sevirce. Noda IPA tasted great

4wuWRASNEAg6atoUVQvJAw.text: Went in on Sunday 1/6/19 at 1:00. We've been wanting to try it. Food was good, but as far as service goes...it gets a 2 outta 10 from me. We entered and a woman with very short curly hair just says "How many?" Whatever happened to 'hello' or 'how are you today?' We sit down and our waiter was ok at first but when it came time to get our food he was gone and some other guy literally just brought it to the table and dropped it down. Never said a word. The tables near us that came much later than us had their food already and we were just a table of two.  The guy that plopped our food on the table was taller w a red and black plaid shirt and dark hair. Just rude.  We ate and then sat there waiting for whatever server might show this time, then plaid guy showed up again after we called him over. . We told him we haven't seen our waiter and thought he may have gone home and that we needed takeout containers.  We had four sides and they only gave us two small round containers and one small container for the chicken and we had to ask for more containers and a bigger chicken box. So who showed up for that container drop off but our original waiter that was MIA before. So we walk out with all the lose containers balancing in our hands (because they didn't give us a bag) and then we walk out near the same female that was supposedly the greeter that was there when we walked in and she never said a word. She saw us w all the containers and didn't offer up a bag or say "Have a good day."  Because of their lousy service and basically no real adults out front teaching staff how to treat customers (especially in the South, where people are supposedly known for their friendliness) we won't be back. Somebody at the top is dropping the ball with staff training about these important details and how to be more accommodating and just plain friendly in general. Unfortunate.

mVQ0R8xIPJqB_KtyQbzG2g.text: I really liked this new NODA spot!  It's not very big inside, but it has a beautiful layout and bar area, which i'm told is inspired by it's textile mill heritage. Good spot for dinner or to have some hand made cocktails and small plates!   The menu is fairly simple and not very expensive compared to the atmosphere it displays.  Two of us shared the half chicken, two starters and two sides and one beer for less than $30.    On to the food!  4/5 of the food items we ordered were delicious!  We got the pimento cheese ball, which comes like a standard cheese ball, covered with toasted spiced Pecans.  The special crackers they serve with it, makes for a delicious combination.  We also ordered the smoked deviled eggs, which were very solid.  For our entree we split the half chicken (two decent sized breasts, one leg and one wing)  the skin on this chicken was some of the best i've ever had! We ordered the mac and cheese as a side.  It was white cheddar mac and it was delicious.  You can order it with crumbled fried chicken skin on top, which i highly recommend!    The one thing we didn't like was the Sweet Potato Dumplings.  I was really excited for them, but the taste didn't do it for me or my wife.  Maybe it was a bad batch, but the waitress was kind enough to take it off.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Deviled Eggs
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento Cheese Ball

T_AHM9nkkVkxVAhpXoms8w.text: Good solid southern food! I especially love the atmosphere here, the designer did a bang-up job. We took my mother in law here (native southerner who basically invented fried chicken and clogged arteries), and even she adored it! It's actually pretty kid friendly too, depending on when you come. This is a great solid addition to NODA!

MFZ1TmHD6C7tGvgLg5fxKQ.text: Exploring NODA and liked what I saw from the outside of Haberdish so I went in.     Sat at the bar.  Very nice ambience and it appears that they know how to make cocktails as they had a wide variety of bitters and other accoutrements for cocktail makings.  This night however, I ordered a pale ale from their beer menu.  My order consisted of a hushpuppy starter which is served with a "sweet tea" butter.  Interesting mild flavor.  Nice.  My main was a 1/2 fried chicken which I was told they are known for.  It was good.  It's fried chicken but it hit the spot and was very reasonably priced.  As a side a had a collard greens special.  Tasty and went well with the fried chicken and as a follow on the hush puppies.     All in all, a nice place, with good atmosphere, food, beer or drinks.  Worthy of a return visit.  :)

Yj0oNzSQdu8b7GoJ6INLyg.text: Really nice chic chill spot. The food was good, I had the Smoked Chicken with Alabama white sauce... DELISH! My other half had the Fried Chicken and it was fried really well! The Mac and cheese was not my favorite but it could do. The okra thought was realllyyy good! Drinks are good here too!

ofcACR-X3vqitSGxAsEgRA.text: Best. Fried. Chicken. Ever. This place is a Charlotte gem and is a personal favorite of mine. The interior is well decorated, clean, and the staff has always been super nice and welcoming. This place is very popular so the wait can get a little long but there is so much to see around the neighborhood that the time will fly if you explore a bit while you wait. Their fried chicken is cooked and seasoned to perfection while always being super juicy. The Mac n Cheese with crispy chicken skins is a must have. The fried okra is amazing and it's truly hard to cook well without it being slimy but Haberdish does it very well. The banana pudding is extremely good but needs a bit more cookies in it ( I personally like a lot of vanilla wafers in mine but to each their own). The bar also are on point with their drinks and never skimp on the booze. All in all a definite A+.

sayxndzoYtpE_SRAKqTA3Q.text: Hip decor. Try a bunch of small sides. We sampled the house pickles, smoked deviled eggs are a must. Fried chicken is there specialty. Skip the kale salad, good but boring. Our server was fun and knowledgeable. Visiting town but will definitely be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

YWfUeG_Jh17CjzXtvn-uNA.text: Holy moly. I stopped in here for lunch on a whim last weekend. What a treat!  It wasn't crowded at all at 3 pm on a Saturday. I was by myself so I grabbed a seat at the bar. I ordered their fried cauliflower with a side of charred okra and sweet potato dumplings. I also ordered some cheese straws to start.   The cheese straws were good -- kind of hard to mess those up -- but not anything I'd just have to have again. I liked the presentation: served standing up in a mason jar.   The sides were delicious. The okra came kind of tossed with bacon jam which added a nice depth of flavor. It was charred just right and the okra had a perfect texture. The sweet potato dumplings were not at all like I had envisions but they were delicious, nonetheless.   The cauliflower though. My god, THE CAULIFLOWER! First off, I am fairly sure I got an entire head of cauliflower. It was huge! Second off, the textures and flavors were perfect. The sides complemented it nicely but I'd have been satisfied with the cauliflower alone.   Everyone I interacted with was really friendly. I liked the overall vibe but it could feel entirely different at a busier time.   As for pricing, I got out of there for under $40 including tip. This is more than reasonable when you consider I had enough leftovers for dinner that night and lunch the next day. It could be a really nice place for an in-between date night: not too dive-y but not too uppity either. Assuming the portion sizes are consistent across their menu, you could easily split an entree and some sides, then splurge on one of their amazing sounding cocktails or desserts.   I'm glad I finally got to try the place. I look forward to going back for a date night, or girls' night, and trying some more of what they have to offer.

zMcZXX6cJcV1u9KfvfOPtQ.text: I absolutely love the atmosphere and food! Really great breakfast and dinner option! Would suggest people to visit at anytime

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ys4vfliqX-YG4XgbwUxhCQ.text: Decided to try Haberdish last and wasn't disappointed. A lot of restaurants that try to add a twist on southern food miss the mark but for the most part Haberdish succeeded.   It's tucked away in NoDa and offers a great cozy atmosphere and a craft cocktail bar.  We ordered the fried chicken and roast chicken for our entrees. Everyone agreed that the fried chicken hit the rare combination between crispy-crunchy skin outside and moist juicy meat inside. The skin's flavor was okay--decently seasoned but could stand improvement. The roast chicken was equally moist with a tasty white sauce drizzled over it.  One area Haberdish could improve on would be the side dish department. The side selection is small and none really stand out. Our group ordered the kale grits, charred okra, and mac and cheese with spicy chicken skins on top. The kale "grits" were good but I wouldn't call them grits per se. The charred okra was good. Our group all believes that if mac and cheese isn't baked it's not real mac and cheese. This mac and cheese was the creamy stove top cooks version so it wasn't our favorite but the spicy chicken skins on top were delicious and I think Haberdish would do well serving a spicy version of their fried chicken entree.  All in all I think Haberdish was a good experience and I would recommend it to people for a good relatively inexpensive night out in NoDa. If you're looking for authentic soul/southern food you'll be disappointed but if you're looking for comfort food with a twist you'll leave happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charred Okra
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and Cheese with spicy chicken skins.
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 Roast Chicken with Alabama white sauce.

BjvaHjwPzz5cy01FTnNHIg.text: Enjoyed it! Went on Sunday. Used the yelp app to make a reservation which was perfect. However yelp app told me to check in by 12:41 and it told me that there were 5 guests in front of me. So i leave the house and head to the restaurant... i didn't realize that the restaurant texted my phone to indicate my table was ready at 12:30 sooooo by the time i got there my Yelp indicated that my reservation had been cancelled! This was unfortunate because i didn't realize I'd received the text long boring story short the hostess apologized for my silly mistake and seated us immediately when I got there

KuYQLOdKyS-ywMCfV_9vmQ.text: This restaurant has become our absolute favorite.    I'm Vegan and to find a restaurant with such great choices, has been a True find. My husband loves the  deviled eggs and Fried chicken. We both love the Blond Bloody Mary's. Atmosphere is welcoming and fits well with the entire NODA scene. We use the no wait app and it has made a huge difference in our wait time.  Just can't say enough about this restaurant. The farm to table concept is delicious. We have and will continue to dine here often.

InjX5s8mEb_OJMIA2-2N7w.text: Great food and great service. First time there and couldn't be happier. They felt they took too long to bring us our drinks (didn't say a word) but brought them and apologized for the wait. First time that has ever happened to me at a restaurant (been lucky?) As a native here I felt like it was just southern hospitality to go along with my delicious chicken and waffles (thigh of course) and the buttery syrup. Do yourself a favor and stop reading reviews and just go get some damn good food and drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Haberdish - Charlotte, NC, United States

7evz1Y2X9lpiY99Gu9PI-g.text: Found this place in passing, the food is very good! Awesome atmosphere and the service is great! A little disappointed because we ordered the Cauliflower steak and thought it could be a steak with Cauliflower, but it turned out to be Cauliflower cooked as if it was a chicken fried steak. Still very good
